virginensis: <entryFree id="n51062" type="main" key="Virgi^nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presided over the loosing of the bridal zone</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; 6, 9.</sense></entryFree>
virginesvendonides: <entryFree id="n51063" type="main" key="Virgi^nesvendo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭnesvendŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comically<cb n="VIRG" />  formed from virgo - vendo</etym>, <sense id="n51063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">virginseller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 20</bibl> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
virgineus: <entryFree id="n51064" type="main" key="virgi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a maiden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maidenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for virginalis): <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 563</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 631: facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 75" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>offered by a maiden</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favilla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a virgin's funeral pile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Spartan virgins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">focus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Vesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 44; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:731" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 731</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginea domitus sagittā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Danaides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:67" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helicon, as the seat of the Muses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden crown received by the victor at the festival of Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Harpies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 216</bibl></cit>: aqua, <hi rend="ital">the aqueduct called</hi> Aqua Virgo (v. virgo, D.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:464" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 464</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also virgineus liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virginia: <entryFree id="n51065" type="main" key="Virgi_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Verginius.</entryFree>
virginitas: <entryFree id="n51066" type="main" key="virgi^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maidenhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virginity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 487</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 695</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:449" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 449</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51066.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. = virgines (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adulta virginitas castitasque nuptarum flens ultima ducebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virginius: <entryFree id="n51067" type="main" key="Virgi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, v. Verginius.</entryFree>
virginor: <entryFree id="n51068" type="hapax" key="virgi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behave like a virgin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to play the virgin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
virgo: <entryFree id="n51069" type="main" key="virgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root varg-; Sanscr. ūrg, strength, ūrga-jami, nourish; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)rga/w</foreign>, to swell, <foreign lang="greek">o)rgh/</foreign>, impulse</etym>, <sense id="n51069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virgin</hi> (cf. puella). </sense><sense id="n51069.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51069.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sabinas honesto ortas loco virgines rapi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio philosophorum) casta, verecunda, virgo incorrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pallas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 754</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:459" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 459</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:383" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 17</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>: dea, <hi rend="ital">the virgin goddess</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:92:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 92, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of female animals that have not coupled, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:357" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:56:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 56, 1</bibl></cit>.—Adject.: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 10, § 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of particular virgins.—Of a <hi rend="ital">Vestal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esset decimus annus post Virginum absolutionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines sanctae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 1</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the Danaides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 26</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Astrœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51069.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of young females, <hi rend="ital">a young woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:435" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.6" n="B" level="2"> In the eccl. fathers, of males, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 22, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51069.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Virgo <hi rend="ital">in the zodiac</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:25" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:24" default="NO">3, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51069.8" n="D" level="2"> Aqua Virgo, or simply Virgo, <hi rend="ital">a stream of cold water brought to Rome in an aqueduct constructed by M. Agrippa</hi> (so called because a young girl discovered its source), now <hi rend="ital">Fontana Trevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:47:6" default="NO">11, 47, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:163:2 al" default="NO">14, 163, 2 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 703 sq.—</sense><sense id="n51069.9" n="E" level="2"> Of things; as an adjectival appellative for <hi rend="ital">unwedded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unused</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unmarried</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliva,</quote> <trans><tr>fasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>untilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>: charta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that has not been read</hi> or <hi rend="ital">published</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 67, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">EMIT ET COMPARAVIT LOCVM VIRGINEM,</quote> <trans><tr>vacant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4566</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgosus: <entryFree id="n51070" type="main" key="virgo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virga</etym>, <sense id="n51070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of twigs</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frutex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
virgula: <entryFree id="n51071" type="main" key="virgu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <trans><tr>a divining-rod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 158</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Varro</hi>, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 550, 12</bibl>: censoria, <hi rend="ital">a critical mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a sign of spuriousness</hi> (i. q. obelus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">an</hi> <pb n="1996" /> <cb n="VIRI" /> <hi rend="ital">accentual mark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 273</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a stripe</hi> on a garment, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:207" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 207</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">a slight column</hi> of smoke, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgulatus: <entryFree id="n51072" type="hapax" key="virgu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgula</etym>, <sense id="n51072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striped</hi> (cf. virga, II. C., and virgatus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virgultum: <entryFree id="n51073" type="main" key="virgultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from virguletum, from virgula</etym> (only in <number>plur.</number>), <sense id="n51073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thicket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubbery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:E. 10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:A. 5:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 661</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:90" default="NO">11, 2, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51073.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Slips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cuttings</hi> of trees: <cit><quote lang="la">defodere in terram virgulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:933" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 933</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virgultus: <entryFree id="n51074" type="main" key="virgultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virgultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virgultum</etym>, <sense id="n51074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bushes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thickets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrubby</hi>: vallis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 354</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virguncula: <entryFree id="n51075" type="main" key="virguncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virguncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>virgo</etym>, <sense id="n51075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little maid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young girl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 40</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">virguncula puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriae: <entryFree id="n51076" type="main" key="vi^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ornament for the arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armlets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bracelets</hi> (syn. armilla), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 1, 9, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriathus: <entryFree id="n51077" type="main" key="Vi^ri^a_thus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭāthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated leader of the Lusitanians in the war against the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:54" default="NO" valid="yes">54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO">2, 90, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 354</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:219" default="NO">10, 219</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭāthīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Viriathus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriatus: <entryFree id="n51078" type="main" key="vi^ri^a_tus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viriae</etym>, <sense id="n51078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with bracelets</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 187:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 187, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriculae: <entryFree id="n51079" type="hapax" key="vi_ri^cu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vires, from vis</etym>, <sense id="n51079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii,</quote> <trans><tr>small means</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriculum: <entryFree id="n51080" type="main" key="vi_ri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a graving-tool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burin</hi>, = cestrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 41, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viridarium: <entryFree id="n51081" type="main" key="vi^ri^da_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdārĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>and</itype>, contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">virdĭārĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>viridis</etym>, <sense id="n51081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pleasure-garden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:26" default="NO">33, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
viride: <entryFree id="n51082" type="main" key="vi^ri^de^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. viridis <sense id="n51082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viridesco: <entryFree id="n51083" type="main" key="vi^ri^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n51083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [viridis], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become green</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 1, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spir. Sanc. prol. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viridia: <entryFree id="n51084" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. viridis, B. 2.</entryFree>
viridiarium: <entryFree id="n51085" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. viridarium <sense id="n51085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viridicans: <entryFree id="n51086" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [viridis], <sense id="n51086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavositates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viridicatus: <entryFree id="n51087" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [id.], <sense id="n51087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit> dub.; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Bait. virdicata).</sense></entryFree>
viridis: <entryFree id="n51088" type="main" key="vi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n51088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> viridum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:279" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 279</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vireo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">green.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51088.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (as the most general designation for every shade of that color). </sense><sense id="n51088.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colles nitidissimi viridissimique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis opacaque ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridiores herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridia atque umida ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereidum comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: caelum, <hi rend="ital">bluish green</hi> (when it is clear), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51088.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭde</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n51088.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bacis e viridi rubentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>reddish green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">e viridi pallens (gemma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51088.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A green thing</hi>, of plants, trees, etc. (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 43, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne viride agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">green plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbs</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trees</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51088.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridiora praemiorum genera (opp. arescentes laureae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:8:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis et adhuc dulcis fructus studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit> 6, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">indignantium, tam viridem et in flore aetatis ereptum esse rebus humanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus earum (litterarum) viridior vegetiorque,</quote> <trans><tr>livelier and stronger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cb n="VIRI" /> firmior et viridior sonus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euryalus formā insignis viridique juventā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 304</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 187</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. praef. § 12: usque ad novissimam valetudinem viridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:742" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex, sed mehercule viridis animo ac vigens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio viridis, sed belli serus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 255</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridissimus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 569</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĕ</orth>, <hi rend="ital">greenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil omnino viridius comparatum illis (smaragdis) viret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viriditas: <entryFree id="n51089" type="main" key="vi^ri^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>viridis</etym>, <sense id="n51089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viridity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbescens viriditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51089.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">freshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briskness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus aufert eam viriditatem, in quā etiam nunc erat Scipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigere et habere quandam viriditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea illa amittit longo intervallo viriditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virido: <entryFree id="n51090" type="main" key="vi^ri^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51090.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to grow green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:136" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada subnatis viridentur ab herbis,</quote> <trans><tr>become green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 90</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n51090.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> viridans, <hi rend="ital">growing green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingit viridanti tempora lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1396" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus ut viridante toro consederat herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 785</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viridomarus: <entryFree id="n51091" type="main" key="Viridoma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Viridomărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Virdum-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the Ædui</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 41</bibl> (called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Virdomărus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
virilis: <entryFree id="n51092" type="main" key="vi^ri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virile</hi> (cf.: mas, masculus). </sense><sense id="n51092.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51092.2" n="A" level="2"> In respect of sex, <hi rend="ital">male</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masculine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51092.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: virile et muliebre secus, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virile secus, i. e. puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:189" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <trans><tr>of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:403" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 403</bibl></cit>; cf. balnea, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>the love of a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51092.5" n="a" level="4"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1209</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 11, 2</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrī-lia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 61, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:243" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 22, 89, § 243</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui viriliores videbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51092.6" n="b" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">of the masculine gender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masculine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10</bibl></cit>, §§ 21 and 30 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4 al" default="NO">11, 1, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51092.7" n="B" level="2"> In respect of strength, vigor, etc., <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full-grown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrived at the years of manhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversis studiis aetas animusque virilis Quaerit opes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte seniles Mandentur juveni partes pueroque viriles,</quote> <trans><tr>the parts of fullgrown men</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna domus tuae morietur cum ad virilem aetatem venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed by Roman youth in their sixteenth year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34, 4 al.</bibl>—Opp. to female garments: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpsisti virilem togam quam statim muliebrem stolam reddidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that falls to a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to each one</hi> in the division of inheritances: ut ex bonis ejus, qui, etc., virilis pars patrono debeatur, <hi rend="ital">a proportionate part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an equal share</hi> with others, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota bona pro virilibus partibus ad liberos defuncti pertinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:54:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 54, § 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virilis portio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:5:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 5, 8</bibl></cit> pr.; 31, 1, 70, § 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n51092.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Virilis pars or portio, <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi> of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliqua mea pars virilis, quod ejus civitatis sum, quam ille claram reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>my part</tr>, <tr>my duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam pars virilis postulat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">7: cum illius gloriae pars virilis apud omnes milites sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem agrum miles pro parte virili manu cepisset, eum senex quoque vindicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 71, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec qui pro virili parte defendunt, optimates sunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the utmost of their ability</tr>, <tr>as far as in them lies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pro virili parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro parte virili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; Ov. <cb n="VIRO" /> Tr. 5, 11, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">pro virili portione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51092.11" n="(b)" level="5"> In other connections (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">actoris partis chorus officiumque virile Defendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 193</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n51092.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of quality, <hi rend="ital">worthy of a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">veretur quicquam aut facere aut loqui, quod parum virile videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum inflexio fortis ac virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatio laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa res est animo virili, consilio puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ingenii (with solida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio (with fortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio atque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim oratorius iste, immo hercle ne virilis quidem cultus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">manly deeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 15</bibl> Dietsch.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ALMIAE SABINAE MATRI VIRILISSIMAE, etc., Inscr. Grud. p. 148, n. 5.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">manfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageously</hi> (acc. to II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:479" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 479</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.,</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virilitas: <entryFree id="n51093" type="main" key="vi^ri_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virilis</etym>, <sense id="n51093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manhood</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n51093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51093.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The age of manhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51093.3" n="B" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">manhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaiam C. Caesarem, quasi incertae virilitatis, dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adempta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51093.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the organs of generation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 4, 3, § 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:5 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 5 al.</bibl>—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 44</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n51093.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas certe. et, ut sic dicam, virilitas ab his (veteribus Latinis) petenda, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriliter: <entryFree id="n51094" type="main" key="vi^ri_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. virilis <sense id="n51094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viriola: <entryFree id="n51095" type="main" key="vi^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>viriae</etym>, <sense id="n51095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bracelet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:40" default="NO">34, 2, 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viriose: <entryFree id="n51096" type="main" key="vi^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>viriosus</etym>, <sense id="n51096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
viriosus: <entryFree id="n51097" type="main" key="vi^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis</etym>, <sense id="n51097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitia usu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
viriplaca: <entryFree id="n51098" type="main" key="Vi^ri^pla_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭrĭplāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir-placo</etym>, a name of the goddess (Juno) who, in her temple on the Palatine Hill, reconciles husbands to their wives, <sense id="n51098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appeaser of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viripotens: <entryFree id="n51099" type="hapax" key="vi_ri^po^tens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vis-potior</etym>, <sense id="n51099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mighty in power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51100" type="main" key="vi^ri^po^tens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir-potior</etym>, <sense id="n51100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for a husband</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">marriageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nubile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:58" default="NO">26, 7, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:99" default="NO">35, 1, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viritanus: <entryFree id="n51101" type="gloss" key="vi^ri_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrītānus</orth> <itype>ager dicitur, qui viritim populo distribuitur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
viritim: <entryFree id="n51102" type="main" key="vi^ri_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrītim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">man by man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to each one separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individually</hi> (used only with distrib. numerals, never with card.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n51102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viritim dicitur dari, quod datur per singulos viros. Cato: praeda, quae capta est, viritim divisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=378" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 378</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui legem de agro Gallico viritim dividendo tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viritim dispertire aliquid populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distribuere pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare tricenos nummos cohortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi viritim deleti,</quote> <trans><tr>one and all</tr>, <tr>all together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51102.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">each by itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individually</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">in universum de ventis diximus: nunc viritim incipiamus illos discutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possum donare sapienti, quod viritim meum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his, quae viritim ei serviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commonefacere beneficii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 4</bibl></cit>: prompta studia, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi> (with nondum aperta consensione), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere terereque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viromandui: <entryFree id="n51103" type="main" key="Vi_romandu^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīromandŭi</orth>, v. Veromandui.</entryFree>
viror: <entryFree id="n51104" type="main" key="vi^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vireo</etym>, <sense id="n51104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdure</hi> (post-class. for viriditas): <cit><quote lang="la">pratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superest aliquid de virore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virosus: <entryFree id="n51105" type="main" key="vi^ro_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n51105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing after men</hi>: uxor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 21, 30</bibl>; Afran. ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223</bibl> <pb n="1997" /> <cb n="VIRU" /> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: qui non modo vinosus, sed virosus quoque sit, Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51106" type="main" key="vi_ro_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virus</etym>. <sense id="n51106.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered with slime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slimy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 257, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum adversus stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 103" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51106.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having a bad odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virosi odoris sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 163" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eluvies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>urine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 355</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51106.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Poisonous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51106.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 332</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51106.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures mariti virosa susurronum faece completae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
virtuosus: <entryFree id="n51107" type="main" key="virtu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virtŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virtus</etym>, <sense id="n51107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">virtuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Sec. Man. 10.</sense></entryFree>
virtus: <entryFree id="n51108" type="main" key="virtu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virtūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype> (<sense id="n51108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> virtutium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 34</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> VIRTVTEI, Inscr. Corp. Lat. 1, 30 and 34), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manhood</hi>, i. e. the sum of all the corporeal or mental excellences of man, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor; bravery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage; aptness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity; worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus clara aeternaque habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni virtus fidesque vostra spectata mihi forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n51108.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51108.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fiet, ut animi virtus corporis virtuti anteponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his virtutibus ornatus, modestiā, temperantiā, justitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes continentiae, gravitatis, justitiae, fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus atque integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris vis divina virtusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, and of inanimate or abstract things, <hi rend="ital">goodness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam nec arboris, nec equi virtus (in quo abutimur nomine) in opinione sita est, sed in naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium-solo bono, suā virtute valeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merci pretium statui, pro virtute ut veneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoriae virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio habet virtutes tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi (opp. vitium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">17: facundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51108.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51108.5" n="A" level="2"> In the phrase deūm virtute, usu. with dicam, <hi rend="ital">by the aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">merit of the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the gods be thanked</hi> (anteclass), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute deūm et majorum nostrūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 71</bibl> dub.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 85</bibl> and 90; <cit><quote lang="la">so virtute eorum (i. e. majorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Moral perfection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51108.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem virtus nihil aliud quam in se perfecta et ad summum perducta natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est animi habitus naturae modo rationi consentaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes rectae animi affectiones virtutes appellentur ... Appellata est ex viro virtus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est quasi artem aliquam, nisi utare ... virtus in usu sui tota posita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in eo virtus et probitas et summum officium summaque observantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28</bibl></cit>, a, 2.—</sense><sense id="n51108.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Virtue</hi>, personified as a deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 13, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:115 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 115 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51108.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Military talents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortitude</hi> (syn. fortitudo), etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii reliquos Gallos virtute praecedunt, quod fere cottidianis proeliis cum Germanis contendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 13: militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes">62, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudi virtute Neronis Armenius cecidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51108.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Obstinacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virulentia: <entryFree id="n51109" type="main" key="vi_ru^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>virulentus</etym>, <sense id="n51109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offensive odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
virulentus: <entryFree id="n51110" type="main" key="vi_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>virus</etym>, <sense id="n51110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poisonous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
virunum: <entryFree id="n51111" type="main" key="viru_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">virūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Noricum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
virus: <entryFree id="n51112" type="main" key="vi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. visham; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)o/s</foreign>, poison</etym>, <sense id="n51112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slimy liquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slime.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51112.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of animals and plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 281</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:45" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 15, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:104" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 104</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">animal sperm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">semen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n51112.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poisonous liquid</hi>, <cb n="VIS" /> <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virus</hi> (syn. venenum). </sense><sense id="n51112.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=432" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">evomere virus acerbitatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futile virus linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:560" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:476" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An offensive odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stench</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 853</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:107" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 83, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:185" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 52, § 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoris,</quote> <trans><tr>an offensive pungency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 23, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51112.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saline taste;</hi> of sea-water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 476</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:635" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 635</bibl>.—Of wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vis: <entryFree id="n51113" type="main" key="vi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīs</orth>, <itype>vis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <number>plur.</number> vīres, ĭum (class. only in <case>nom.</case>, <case>acc.</case> and <sense id="n51113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> and in <hi rend="ital">plur.; gen. sing.</hi> very rare; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> vi, Auct. B. Afr. 69, 2; C. I.
