L. 5, 837; collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> vis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 586</bibl>; Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 707</bibl>, or H. 3, 62 Dietsch; Messala ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 14</bibl>) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/s, vis</foreign>, sinew, force; <foreign lang="greek">i)=fi</foreign>, with might], <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, physical or mental; <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi> (cf. robur). </sense><sense id="n51113.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51113.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51113.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas et vis equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 70, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis eorum (urorum) et magna velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vim atque impetum fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 326</bibl></cit> (301): <cit><quote lang="la">horrida teli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri aerisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n51113.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (most freq. of physical strength): <cit><quote lang="la">non viribus aut velocitatibus aut celeritate corporum res magnae geruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nunc vires desidero adulescentis, non plus quam adulescens tauri aut elephanti desiderabam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ali vires nervosque confirmari putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me jam sanguis viresque deficiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauci viribus confisi transnatare contenderunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri integris viribus fortiter repugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertis et viribus pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus viribus atque opibus repugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non animi solum vigore sed etiam corporis viribus excellens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis viribus hastam contorquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid agas, decet agere pro viribus,</quote> <trans><tr>with all your might</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">supra vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et neglecta solent incendia sumere vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu virium vi seu exercitatione multā cibi vinique capacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelii concursu abit res a Consilio ad vires vimque pugnantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 4</bibl></cit> dub. (Siebel. vires usumque).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi sunt vires inimicos pellere tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51113.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potency</hi> (of herbs, drugs, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">in radices vires oleae abibunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires habet herba?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 942</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius fons Viribus occultis adjuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51113.7" n="b" level="4"> Vis, personified, the same as <hi rend="ital">Juno</hi>, Aus. Idyll. de Deis; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 432</bibl> Serv. —</sense><sense id="n51113.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Hostile strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/a</foreign>: EA POENA, QVAE EST DE VI, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vi vis illata defenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celeri rumore dilato Dioni vim allatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vim facias ullam in illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine vi facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim afferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 30, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio tam valido et armato vim adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter per vim tentare,</quote> <trans><tr>by force</tr>, <tr>forcibly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem satis est, nisi docet, ita se possedisse nec vi nec clam nec precario possederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 32, 92</bibl></cit>; so the jurid. formula in Lex Thoria ap. Grut. 202, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis haec quidem hercle est, et trahi et trudi simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves totae factae ex robore ad quamvis vim et contumeliam perferendam (shortly afterwards: tantas tempestates Oceani tantosque impetus ventorum sustineri),</quote> <trans><tr>violence</tr>, <tr>shock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>a storm</tr>, <tr>tempest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 278</bibl></cit>.—To avoid the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> form (v. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">de vi condemnati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: de vi reus; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei qui de vi itemque ei qui majestatis damnatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 21</bibl> sq. Halm ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.9" n="d" level="4"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>: pudicitiam cum eriperet militi tribunus militaris ... interfectus ab eo est, <cb n="VISC" /> cui vim adferebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matribus familias vim attulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis allata sorori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victa nitore dei vim passa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim passa est Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 679</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n51113.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> (cf.: copia, multitudo); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi retruderet hominum me vis invitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilis servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pompā cum magna vis auri argentique ferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis magna pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis maxima ranunculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim lacrimarum profudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odora canum vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nescio quomodo is, qui auctoritatem minimam habet, maximam vim, populus cum illis facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.12" n="2" level="3"> Vires, <hi rend="ital">military forces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeesse exercitui, ut praeter auctoritatem vires quoque ad coërcendum haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis virium ad certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique contractis viribus signa cum Papirio conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur omne virium ejus regni,</quote> <trans><tr>the flower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitet et vires Graecia magna suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 340.—</sense><sense id="n51113.13" n="3" level="3"> Vires, <hi rend="ital">the virile forces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">organs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 158</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti castratis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (= vires) multas possidere in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 586</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51113.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mental strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illa divina et virtus oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ac facultas oratoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitatem Isocrates ... sonitum Aeschines, vim Demosthenes habuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est conscientiae in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis est in fortunā in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ostentum habuit hanc vim, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>power</tr>, <tr>effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui indignitate suā vim ac jus magistratui quem gerebat dempsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus conventionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:25:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 25, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:32" default="NO">12, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51113.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essence</hi> (cf. significatio): <cit><quote lang="la">id, in quo est omnis vis amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae vis et natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis honesti (with natura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est alia vis legis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis, natura, genera verborum et simplicium et copulatorum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the sense</tr>, <tr>signification</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis insit in his paucis verbis, si attendes, si attendes, intelleges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis subjecta sit vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">metwnumi/a</foreign>, cujus vis est, pro eo, quod dicitur, causam, propter quam dicitur, ponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viscatorium: <entryFree id="n51114" type="main" key="visca_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>visco</etym>, <sense id="n51114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snare</hi> (late Lat.), Manich. Cit. Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 3, 74.</sense></entryFree>
viscatus: <entryFree id="n51115" type="main" key="visca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [id.], <sense id="n51115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smeared with birdlime</hi>: virgae, <hi rend="ital">limed twigs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 391</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51115.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: omnia viscatis manibus leget, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 332, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">396, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51115.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscata beneficia devitare,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>entangling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>for which one expects a good return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscellatus: <entryFree id="n51116" type="main" key="viscella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. viscus</etym>, <sense id="n51116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed with the entrails</hi> of fishes or of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
viscellinus: <entryFree id="n51117" type="main" key="Viscelli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Viscellīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agnomen of the consul</hi> Sp. Cassius, <hi rend="ital">who was put to death for aiming at the sovereignty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visceratim: <entryFree id="n51118" type="hapax" key="visce^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. viscus</etym>, <sense id="n51118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>: dissupat membra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 183, 17</bibl> (Trag. v. 145 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
visceratio: <entryFree id="n51119" type="main" key="visce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public distribution of flesh</hi> cr <hi rend="ital">mcat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3858</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine amico visceratio, leonis ac lupi vita est,</quote> <trans><tr>a feeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscereus: <entryFree id="n51120" type="main" key="visce^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of flesh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum nondum viscereum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which had not yet been employed in the creation of man</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1093</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1998" /> <cb n="VISI" /></sense></entryFree>
viscidus: <entryFree id="n51121" type="main" key="visci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viscum</etym>, <sense id="n51121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clammy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6</bibl>: viscidiores cibi, id. de Diaeta, 18.</sense></entryFree>
visco: <entryFree id="n51122" type="main" key="visco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">visco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n51122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se inter articulorum conjunctiones usu commotionum viscaverit (sanies),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirat et hinc miseri viscantur labra mariti,</quote> <trans><tr>are glued</tr>, <tr>smeared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:463" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscosus: <entryFree id="n51123" type="main" key="visco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viscum</etym>, <sense id="n51123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of birdlime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sticky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 824</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viscum: <entryFree id="n51124" type="main" key="viscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 16</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)co/s, vicos</foreign>; Lat. viscus], <sense id="n51124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mistletoe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 94, § 248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 205</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51124.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">birdlime</hi> made from the berries of the mistletoe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:263" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51124.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscus merus vestra est blanditia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus sum vehementer visco: cor stimulo foditur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with love</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viscus: <entryFree id="n51125" type="main" key="viscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, and more freq. in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">viscĕra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prop. the soft parts; cf.: viscum, viscidus</etym>, <sense id="n51125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inner parts</hi> of the animal body, <hi rend="ital">the internal organs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscera</hi> (the nobler parts, the heart, lungs, liver, as well as the ignobler, the stomach, entrails, etc.; cf.: ilia, intestina, exta). </sense><sense id="n51125.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: mortui praecordia et viscus omne, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:719" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 719</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 290</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (only so in class. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:375 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 375 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 846</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 390</bibl>; 15, 314; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:205 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 205 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">the uterus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 8</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the testicles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51125.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The flesh</hi>, as lying under the skin: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Herculi Dejanira sanguine Centauri tinctam tunicam induisset, inhaesissetque ea visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: ut multus e visceribus sanguis exeat, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu quantum scelus est, in viscera viscera condi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 253</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51125.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(Tereus) in suam sua viscera congerit alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 651</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 478</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 118</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera sua flammis inicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one's own writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. § 3 Spald.—</sense><sense id="n51125.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like our <hi rend="ital">bowels</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inmost part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itum est in viscera terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis (Aetnae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medullis populi Romani ac visceribus haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in venis atque in visceribus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in dicendo non extrinsecus alicunde quaerenda, sed ex ipsis visceribus causae sumenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 318</bibl></cit>: quae (<foreign lang="greek">e)gkeleu/smata</foreign>) mihi in visceribus haerent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu patriae validas in viscera vertite vires,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>her own citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de visceribus tuis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from your means</tr>, <tr>property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: magnarum domuum, <hi rend="ital">the heart</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the favorite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51126" type="main" key="viscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. viscum <sense id="n51126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
visibilis: <entryFree id="n51127" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>video</etym>. <sense id="n51127.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi> (late Lat. for adspectabilis): exhalationes tenues vixque visibiles, App. de Mundo, p. 60, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:de Deo Socr. p. 42:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 5, 158</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n51127.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 146</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭter</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">visibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visibilitas: <entryFree id="n51128" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>visibilis, I.</etym>, <sense id="n51128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">visibility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Fulg. ap. Contin. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 750</bibl> Stav.</sense></entryFree>
visibiliter: <entryFree id="n51129" type="main" key="vi_si^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. visibilis <sense id="n51129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
visificus: <entryFree id="n51130" type="main" key="vi_si^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>video- facio</etym>, <sense id="n51130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conferring sight</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
visio: <entryFree id="n51131" type="main" key="vi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>video</etym>, <sense id="n51131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sense of seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51131.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ignes ... nostrae visioni occurrunt, App. de Mundo, p. 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 203, 37: in caelestis sponsi visione requiescere, Greg. Mag. Homil. 2, 2, 8; 2, 2, 12.—</sense><sense id="n51131.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thing seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 120</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51131.3" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="VISU" /> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an image of a thing in the mind; an idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem dei percipi cogitatione ... eamque esse ejus visionem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri falsique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>.—As a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fantasi/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51131.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in propositā quaestione tribus visionibus relatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:29" default="NO">17, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO">22, 3, 25</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visitatio: <entryFree id="n51132" type="main" key="vi_si^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>visito</etym>. * <sense id="n51132.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51132.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A visit</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51132.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a visitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 2, 12.</sense></entryFree>
visitator: <entryFree id="n51133" type="main" key="vi_si^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a visitor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. in Fer. Pentec. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. in Fer. Pentec. 1, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a protector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visito: <entryFree id="n51134" type="main" key="vi_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>viso</etym>. <sense id="n51134.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To see</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia te non visitavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotā facie, quae non visitata sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis forma visitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans><tr>visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51134.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to visit</hi> any one (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum visitasset hominem Carneades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:31:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 31, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51134.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To punish</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 88, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 18, 25</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">super his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51134.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send</hi>, judicially, super vos malitiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 23, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visium: <entryFree id="n51135" type="main" key="visi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">visĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bde/sma</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n51135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">bde/sma</foreign>, visio, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
viso: <entryFree id="n51136" type="main" key="vi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīso</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>video</etym>, <sense id="n51136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at attentively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survey</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n51136.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos nuptiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex muris visite agros vestros ferro inique vastatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda Macedonica omnis, ut viseretur, exposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi audiret potius contumelias inperatoris quam viseret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vise, specta tuo arbitratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visendi causā venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undigue visendi studio Trojana juventus Circumfusa ruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: visendus, <hi rend="ital">to be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth seeing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores visendae magnitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 91, § 242</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: nec civitas ulla visitur, <hi rend="ital">is seen</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exists</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 3, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsenda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">objects worth notice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sights</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae multa visenda habentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51136.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51136.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come in order to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to see to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look after;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ad.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51136.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa in arcem abivit, aedem visere Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 6</bibl>: fit concursus per vias; <cit><quote lang="la">Filios suos quisque visunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51136.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quid me velles, visebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visam si domi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51136.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vise ad portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensus dicit sic: omnes Quirites, inlicium visite huc ad judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=88" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 88</bibl></cit> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n51136.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go to see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to visit</hi> any one, esp. a sick person (qs. to see how he is). </sense><sense id="n51136.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitui ad te venire, ut et viderem te et viserem et cenarem etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem Pamphili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Paphon visit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altos Visere montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, of places: <cit><quote lang="la">propter quem Thespiae visuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>is visited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Octavii domus cum vulgo viseretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51136.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegram esse simulant mulierem: nostra ilico It visere ad eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: L. Piso ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visor: <entryFree id="n51137" type="spur" key="visor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">visor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scout</hi>, only in a gloss ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 2</bibl>; omitted by Draeg. and Halm.</sense></entryFree>
vispellio: <entryFree id="n51138" type="main" key="vispellio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vispellio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of thieves who robbed corpses of their grave-clothes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:7" default="NO">36, 1, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 46, 3, 72, § 5 Momms.</sense></entryFree>
vistula: <entryFree id="n51139" type="main" key="Vistu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vistŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Eastern Germany</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Weichsel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Vistula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vistillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visualis: <entryFree id="n51140" type="main" key="vi_su^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>visus</etym>, <sense id="n51140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attained by sight</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">probatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VITA" /> 51.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the power of vision</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">visibly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 36, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visualitas: <entryFree id="n51141" type="main" key="vi_su^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsŭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>visualis</etym>, <sense id="n51141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the power of seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the faculty of sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visula: <entryFree id="n51142" type="main" key="visu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">visŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visum: <entryFree id="n51143" type="main" key="vi_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>video</etym>, <sense id="n51143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something seen</hi>, !*? <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51143.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">visa somniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit> (3, 21), 20: <cit><quote lang="la">dic age ... visa quid ista ferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51143.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fantasi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an impression made by some external object upon the senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visurgis: <entryFree id="n51144" type="main" key="Vi^surgis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭsurgis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Northern Germany</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Weser</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
visus: <entryFree id="n51145" type="main" key="vi_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of video.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51146" type="main" key="vi_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>video</etym>, <sense id="n51146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking; a look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glance; the faculty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">act of seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: feminas omnes visu nocere, quae duplices pupillas habent, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visu effascinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so quint. 1, 2, 11: corpus visu tactuque manifestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: visus in duas acies (divisus est), Lact. Opif. Dei, 10, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 113 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:406" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 406</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:122" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51146.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51146.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the organ of sight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare inocciduis visibus,</quote> <trans><tr>with everwatchful eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:277" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51146.4" n="B" level="2"> Object., <hi rend="ital">a thing seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus ab utrāque acie aliquanto augustior humano visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite secundarent visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopino territa visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51146.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa esse probabilia, quae quamquam non perciperentur, tamen, quia visum haberent quendam insignem et illustrem, iis sapientis vita regeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vita: <entryFree id="n51147" type="main" key="vi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n51147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> vitaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 396</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vivo; Sanscr. gīv, to live; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bi/os</foreign>, life</etym>, <hi rend="ital">life.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51147.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51147.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus rebus animantium vita tenetur, cibo, potione, spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare, adimere vitam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria praesidia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberos vitae necisque potestatem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum vitae curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego in vitā meā nullā umquam voluptate tantā sum adfectus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam agere honestissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">degere miserrimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam in egestate degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutiorem vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundere pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittere per summum dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitā manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitā diutius esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e vitā discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vitā decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā se privare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā aliquem expellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vita suppetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: si mihi vita contigerit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego hodie tibi bonam vitam feci,</quote> <trans><tr>a pleasant life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam vitam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on the other hand: malae taedia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, as a period of time = aetas (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ii quadragensimum annum vitae non excedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periit anno vitae septimo et quinquagesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et triginta annos vitae explevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO">8, 13</bibl>, ext. 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Dan. 6, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero, si geometrae et grammatici ... omnem suam vitam in singulis artibus consumpserint, sequitur, ut plures quasdam vitas ad plura discenda desideremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. also in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n51147.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51147.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsistence</hi> (Plautinian; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. victus): vitam sibi repperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi concedam quicquam de vitā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A life</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mode of life</hi> (class.): vita hominis <pb n="1999" /> <cb n="VITA" /> ex ante factis spectabitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita rustica honestissima atque suavissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc usus, vita, mores respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inquirendo in utriusque vitam et mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so (with mores) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 172</bibl> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ante philosophiam patefactam hac de re communis vita dubitavit,</quote> <trans><tr>nor was it doubted in common life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita, victusque communis,</quote> <trans><tr>social life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omni vitā atque victu excultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspicere, tamquam in speculum, in vitas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnium vitas amicitia serpit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leal. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Minos) vitas et crimina discit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 433</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51147.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real life</hi> (opp. fancy or fiction): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo est illud e vitā ductum ab Afranio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vitā hominum mediā sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil sine magno Vita labore dedit mortalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.8" n="D" level="2"> Like our <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, to denote a very dear object: <cit><quote lang="la">certe tu vita es mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 33</bibl>.—Hence, mea vita, or simply vita, <hi rend="ital">my life</hi>, as a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO">2, 20</bibl> (3, 13), 17.—</sense><sense id="n51147.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The living</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">mankind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the world;</hi> like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bi/os</foreign> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">rura cano, rurisque deos, his vita magistris Desuevit quernā pellere glande famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnoscat mores vita legatque suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum falsumne sit, vita non decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias in tumultu vita erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A life</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a course of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">career</hi>, as the subject of biography: in hoc exponemus libro de vitā (al. vitam) excellentium imperatorum, Nep. praef. § 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Epam. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae memoriam prosā oratione composuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositā vitae ejus velut summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referam nunc interiorem ac familiarem ejus vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vitas resque gestas clarorum hominum memoriae mandaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The duration of life</hi> (in plants, etc.), <hi rend="ital">duration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum immensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 85, § 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:241" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 90, § 241</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 7, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51147.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An existence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a being</hi>, of spirits in the infernal regions: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues sine corpore vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 292</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 952</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitabilis: <entryFree id="n51148" type="main" key="vi_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vito</etym>, <sense id="n51148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ought to be shunned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitabundus: <entryFree id="n51149" type="main" key="vi_ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evading</hi> (rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n51149.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: vitabundus classem hostium, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 17</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl> Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">Hanno vitabundus castra hostium consulesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51149.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitabundus per saltuosa loca exercitum ductare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter tela hostium vitabundus erumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 101:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 101, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitalis: <entryFree id="n51150" type="main" key="vi_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vita</etym>, <sense id="n51150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vital.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51150.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caloris natura vim habet in se vitalem,</quote> <trans><tr>vital power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus vitalis calor liquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:14" default="NO">7, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:8" default="NO">8, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recepto calore vitali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 17</bibl></cit>;
