<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>air-passages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 828</bibl></cit> aevum, <hi rend="ital">lifetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 14</bibl>: vita, i. e. <hi rend="ital">true life</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 180</bibl> Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen relinquere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 175</bibl></cit> saecla, <hi rend="ital">ages. generations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <trans><tr>upon which one is laid while alive and is laid out when dead</tr>, <tr>a death-bed</tr>, <tr>funeral-couch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42</bibl></cit>: si esse salvum me vis aut vitalem tibi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeping alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long-lived</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51150.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51150.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vī-tāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the means of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsistence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortiferum vitali admiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51150.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vītālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n51150.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The vital parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vitals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 620</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:743" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 743</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51150.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Graveclothes</hi> (cf. supra, lectus vitalis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—</hi>* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vītālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">vitally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitaliter esse animata,</quote> <trans><tr>with life</tr>, <tr>vitally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitalitas: <entryFree id="n51151" type="main" key="vi_ta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vital force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vitality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durat in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 38, 90, § 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:250" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 45, 103, § 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitaliter: <entryFree id="n51152" type="main" key="vi_ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vitalis <sense id="n51152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="VITI" /></sense></entryFree>
vitatio: <entryFree id="n51153" type="main" key="vi_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vito</etym>, <sense id="n51153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoiding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoidance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum, lucis, urbis, fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitecula: <entryFree id="n51154" type="main" key="vi_te^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĕcŭla</orth>, v. viticula.</entryFree>
vitellenses: <entryFree id="n51155" type="main" key="Vitellenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vitellenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitellia: <entryFree id="n51156" type="main" key="Vitelli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vitellĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of the Æqui</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Valmontone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitellianus: <entryFree id="n51157" type="main" key="Vi^telli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Vitellius, B.</entryFree>
vitellina: <entryFree id="n51158" type="main" key="vi^telli_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtellīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (caro) [vitellus, I.], <sense id="n51158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">calf's-flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitellius: <entryFree id="n51159" type="main" key="Vi^telli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtellĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So esp., A. Vitellius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n51159.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtellĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Vitellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vitellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via, so named after him,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51159.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtellĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vitellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vitellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51159.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtellĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n51159.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Soldiers of Vitellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vitellians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51159.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of writing-tablets</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">used by Vitellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:8:2" default="NO">14, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:9" default="NO">14, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vitellum: <entryFree id="n51160" type="main" key="vi^tellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. vitellus, II.</entryFree>
vitellus: <entryFree id="n51161" type="main" key="vi^tellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vitulus</etym>. * <sense id="n51161.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little calf</hi>, as a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51161.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the yolk</hi> of an egg, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:40:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 40, 1</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; Varr. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viteus: <entryFree id="n51162" type="main" key="vi_te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitis</etym>, <sense id="n51162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coliculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <trans><tr>planted with vines</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitex: <entryFree id="n51163" type="main" key="vi_tex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vaja, twig; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/tus</foreign>, rim; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 392" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 392</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n51163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chaste-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Abraham's balm</hi>: Vitex agnus castus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiabilis: <entryFree id="n51164" type="main" key="vi^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitium</etym>, <sense id="n51164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be harmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne jam vitiabilis esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ham. 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiarium: <entryFree id="n51165" type="main" key="vi_ti^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vitis</etym>, <sense id="n51165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nursery for vines</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:1" default="NO">3, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiatio: <entryFree id="n51166" type="main" key="vi^ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vitio</etym>, <sense id="n51166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:23:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiator: <entryFree id="n51167" type="main" key="vi^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupter</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:23:1" default="NO">3, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:23:4" default="NO">3, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 284" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:309" default="NO">309</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viticarpifer: <entryFree id="n51168" type="hapax" key="vi_ti^carpi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭcarpĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitiscarpo-fero</etym>, <sense id="n51168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for pruning vines</hi>: forcipes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 868</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
viticella: <entryFree id="n51169" type="gloss" key="vi_ti^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭcella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viticini: <entryFree id="n51170" type="main" key="Vitici_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Viticīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the territory of Picenum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viticola: <entryFree id="n51171" type="hapax" key="vi_ti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vitis-colo</etym>, <sense id="n51171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cultivator of vines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vine-planter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:193" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viticomus: <entryFree id="n51172" type="main" key="vi_ti^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitis-coma</etym>, <sense id="n51172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowned with vine-leaves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viticula: <entryFree id="n51173" type="main" key="vi_ti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭcŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĕc-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vitis</etym>. <sense id="n51173.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 2, 230</bibl>; Val. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Dir. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> Dir. 11, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51173.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tendril</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fruticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 58, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitifer: <entryFree id="n51174" type="main" key="vi_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n51174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vinebearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:349" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vienna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:107:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 107, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitigenus: <entryFree id="n51175" type="main" key="vi_ti^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitis-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n51175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vine-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced from the vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1072" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1072</bibl></cit>; cf. vitigineus.</sense></entryFree>
vitigineus: <entryFree id="n51176" type="main" key="vi_ti^gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">produced by the vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 16, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf. vitigenus.</sense></entryFree>
vitilena: <entryFree id="n51177" type="hapax" key="vi^ti^le_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭlēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vitium-lena; cf. vitilitigator</etym>, <sense id="n51177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bawd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procuress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malesuada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit> MSS. (Ritschl, invitam lena; Lorenz, viti malesuada plena, ex conj. Speng.). <cb n="VITI" /></sense></entryFree>
vitiligo: <entryFree id="n51178" type="main" key="vi^ti^li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vitium</etym>, <sense id="n51178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cutaneous eruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tetter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 19</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 59, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:129" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 75, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitilis: <entryFree id="n51179" type="main" key="vi_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n51179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">platted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interwoven.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51179.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cistae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves corio circumsutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 206</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n51179.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭlia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things platted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicker-work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:114" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 69, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitilitigator: <entryFree id="n51180" type="hapax" key="vi^ti^li_ti^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭlītĭgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vitium-litigator; cf. vitilena</etym>, <sense id="n51180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brawler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangler</hi>, Cato ap. Plin. praef. § 32; cf. vitilitigo.</sense></entryFree>
vitilitigo: <entryFree id="n51181" type="hapax" key="vi^ti^li_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭlītĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vitium-litigo</etym>, <sense id="n51181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to quarrel disgracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangle to abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calumniate</hi>: scio ego, quae scripta sunt, si palam proferantur, multos fore qui vitilitigent, Cato ap. Plin. praef. § 30; cf. vitilitigator.</sense></entryFree>
vitineus: <entryFree id="n51182" type="hapax" key="vi_ti_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. contr. from vitigineus</etym>, <sense id="n51182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitio: <entryFree id="n51183" type="main" key="vi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vitium</etym>, <sense id="n51183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vitiate</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: corrumpo, noceo). </sense><sense id="n51183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51183.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dira lues quondam Latias vitiaverat auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 626</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem salibus amaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:286" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:136" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:691" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies longis vitiabitur annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum in opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves aliqua offensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51183.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to violate</hi> a woman (cf.: violo, polluo): aliquam in occulto, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:70 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 70 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiati pondera ventris (sc. stupro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51183.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum et contionum significationes sunt nonnumquam vitiatae atque corruptae,</quote> <trans><tr>falsified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit> Halm <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">to make void</hi> the nomination of a day for the census, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsulta arbitrio consulum supprimebantur vitiabanturque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:94" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 94</bibl></cit>: auspicia, Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora limo malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curis vitiatum corpus amaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiose: <entryFree id="n51184" type="main" key="vi^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vitiosus <sense id="n51184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vitiositas: <entryFree id="n51185" type="main" key="vi^ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vitiosus</etym>, <sense id="n51185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faultiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viciousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n51185.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51185.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (Ciceron.): hujus virtutis contraria est vitiositas. Sic enim malo quam malitiam appellare eam, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">kaki/an</foreign> appellant. Nam malitia certi cujusdam vitii nomen est, vitiositas omnium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiositas autem est habitus aut affectio in totā vitā inconstans et a se ipsa dissentiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiosus: <entryFree id="n51186" type="main" key="vi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitium</etym>, <sense id="n51186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of faults</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n51186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecus (with morbosum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (corporis pecudum),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>diseased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51186.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51186.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 29, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosissimus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <trans><tr>chosen contrary to the auspices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: quaeque augur injusta nefasta vitiosa dira deixerit, inrita infectaque sunto, XII. Tab ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistra dum non exquirimus, in dira et in vitiosa incurrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51186.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">morally faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depraved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicious</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl>: si quem conventum velit, Vel vitiosum, vel sine vitio; <cit><quote lang="la">vel probum vel improbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui audierunt philosophos, vitiosi essent discessuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosa et flagitiosa vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosas partes rei publicae exsecare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenies vitiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter summam vitiorum dissimulationem vitiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97, 1</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faultily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defectivelay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruptly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51186.5" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiose se habet membrum tumidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51186.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre res bonas (sc. leges),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: concludere (opp. recte), <pb n="2000" /> <cb n="VITI" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 98</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitiparra: <entryFree id="n51187" type="main" key="vitiparra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vitiparra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, otherwise unknown, perh. the <hi rend="ital">titmouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitis: <entryFree id="n51188" type="main" key="vi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root in Sanscr. vjā, to cover; cf. Goth. vindan; Germ. winden, to bind; Lat. vieo; cf.: vitta, vitex</etym>, <sense id="n51188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grapevine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51188.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 676</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51188.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51188.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine-branch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:8:2" default="NO">1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:592 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 592 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51188.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A centurion's staff</hi>, made of a vine-branch, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:247" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 247</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n51188.5" n="b" level="4"> By a second transf., <hi rend="ital">the office of a centurion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">centurionship</hi>, Juv 14, 193; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:395" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:465" default="NO">12, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:43" default="NO">6, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51188.6" n="B" level="2"> For vinea, <hi rend="ital">a military penthouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mantlet</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. sub, p. 311 Müll. —</sense><sense id="n51188.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine</hi> in gen., of the pumpkin, cucumber, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51188.8" n="D" level="2"> Vitis nigra, <hi rend="ital">black bryony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51188.9" n="E" level="2"> Vitis alba, <hi rend="ital">the plant called also</hi> ampeloleuce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:347" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 347</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitisator: <entryFree id="n51189" type="main" key="vi_ti^sa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītĭ-sător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vitis-sero</etym>, <sense id="n51189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vineplanter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 179</bibl></cit>.—Of Bacchus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>.—Of Saturn, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitium: <entryFree id="n51190" type="main" key="vi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n51190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vitiūm, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 495, 13</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from the same root with vieo, vitis, vitta; prop. a twist; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blemish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice</hi> (syn. menda). </sense><sense id="n51190.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quomodo autem in corpore est morbus, est aegrotatio, est vitium: sic in animo. Morbum appellant totius corporis corruptionem: aegrotationem morbum cum imbecillitate: vitium, cum partes corporis inter se dissident; <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo pravitas membrorum, distortio, deformitas. Itaque illa duo, morbus et aegrotatio, ex totius valetudinis corporis conquassatione et perturbatione gignuntur: vitium autem integrā valetudine ipsum ex se cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:148" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—In buildings, <hi rend="ital">a breach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil est in parietibus aut in tecto vitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si aedes corruerunt vitiumve fecerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have received damage</tr>, <tr>become damaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—In plants, <hi rend="ital">a blemish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive illis (agris) omne per ignem Excoquitur vitium atque exsudat inutilis umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio moriens sitit aëris herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 57</bibl></cit>.—In fruits, <hi rend="ital">the useless part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the core</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiumque cinctum fructu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51190.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51190.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blemish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutius atque acrius vitia in dicente quam recta videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:22" default="NO">12, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soloecismi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicae sectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud mihi vitium'st maximum,</quote> <trans><tr>my greatest fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc si perveneris, meum vitium fuerit,</quote> <trans><tr>my fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis quis fortunae vitio, non suo decexisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem vitio civitatis, non suo, non sunt adsecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male conjecta falsa sunt, non rerum vitio, sed interpretum inscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>: animadverso vitio castrorum totā nocte munitiones proferunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the faulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable position</hi> (just before: <cit><quote lang="la">natura iniquo loco castra ponunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites item conflictati et tempestatis et sentinae vitiis,</quote> <trans><tr>the injurious effects</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese nihil adhuc arbitrari vitio factum eorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini vitio atque amoris feci,</quote> <trans><tr>through the fault of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51190.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51190.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A moral fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">failing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word in prose and poetry; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus, delictum): nullam quidem ob turpitudinem, nullum ob totius vitae non dicam vitium, sed erratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 48, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus et praemia proposita sunt virtutibus et supplicia vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58</bibl></cit>. 247: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est vitium fugere, Hor. ep. 1, 1, 41: senectus est naturā loquacior, ne ab omnibus eam vitiis videar vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: ne sibi vitio verterent, quod abesset a patriā, <hi rend="ital">reckon it a fault</hi>, id. Fam. <cb n="VITR" /> 7, 6, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">te laudem Sex. Roscio vitio et culpae dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51190.6" n="b" level="4"> In respect of female chastity (whether of maidens or wives), <hi rend="ital">a violation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia pudicitiae hujus (Alcumenae) vitium me hic absente est additum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiae ejus nunquam nec vim nec vitium attuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi misere per vim vitium obtulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium auctore redemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 49.— </sense><sense id="n51190.7" n="2" level="3"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a defect in the auspices</hi> or <hi rend="ital">auguries</hi>: si cui servo aut ancillae dormienti evenit, quod comitia prohibere solet, ne id quidem mihi vitium facit, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 234 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id igitur obvenit vitium, quod tu jam Cal. Jan. futurum esse provideras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculum vitio captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum solum vitium est fulmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51190.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fault of language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarismi ac soloecismi foeditas absit ... haec vitia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51190.9" n="4" level="3"> In coinage, t. t., <hi rend="ital">base metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alloy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aurum vitii aliquid addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:9 praef" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 9 praef.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis vitium metallis Excoquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:785" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 785</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vito: <entryFree id="n51191" type="main" key="vi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for vicito; root vic-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">vik</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kw</foreign>, to yield; cf. <foreign lang="greek">i)/xnos</foreign>, trace</etym>, <sense id="n51191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to escape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evade</hi> (class.; syn.: fugio, effugio). </sense><sense id="n51191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas, spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupem et puteum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens, vitatu quidque petitu Sit melius, causas reddet tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosum lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitataque traxit in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51191.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51191.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes suspitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionem celeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum,</quote> <trans><tr>to shun one's self</tr>, <tr>be tired of one's own company</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impatientiam nauseae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51191.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51191.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit in enumeratione vitandum, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne experiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51191.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere vitet Scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitor: <entryFree id="n51192" type="main" key="vi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītor</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭētor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n51192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trunk-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1178, 4</bibl>; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vannorum sirpiarumque vitores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vitreamen: <entryFree id="n51193" type="main" key="vi^tre^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtrĕāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vitrum</etym>; only in <number>plur.</number>, <sense id="n51193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glassware</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitrearius: <entryFree id="n51194" type="hapax" key="vi_^tre^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĕārĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trār-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 24, 5</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glass-worker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glassblower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitreolus: <entryFree id="n51195" type="hapax" key="vi_^tre^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n51195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [vitreus], <hi rend="ital">of glass</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 413</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitreus: <entryFree id="n51196" type="main" key="vi_^tre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitrum</etym>, <sense id="n51196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of glass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glass-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vitreous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51196.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51196.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priapus,</quote> <trans><tr>a glass in the form of a Priapus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a glass chessman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 72, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51196.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">glass vessels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glassware</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 73</bibl>: vitrea fracta, <hi rend="ital">broken glass</hi>, as a designation for <hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51196.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like glass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glassy</hi>, in color or transparency, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transparent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sea-green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circe,</quote> <trans><tr>brilliant</tr>, <tr>beautiful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: togae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 448, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">536, 32</bibl>: turgescit vitrea bilis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">transparent</hi> (transl. of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(alw/dhs xolh/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51196.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>brilliant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 222</bibl></cit>: fortuna, <hi rend="ital">brittle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragile</hi>, P. Syr. Mim. (Sent. v. 189 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
vitriaria: <entryFree id="n51197" type="main" key="vi_^tri^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> parietaria, <hi rend="ital">wall-pellitory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitricus: <entryFree id="n51198" type="main" key="vi_^tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a step-father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of Vulcan,<cb n="VITU" />  the husband of Venus, in relation to Cupid, the son of Jupiter and Venus: <cit><quote lang="la">vitricus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitrum: <entryFree id="n51199" type="main" key="vi_^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^trum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root in video, to see, as transparent; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n51199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51199.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">O fons Bandu siae, splendidior vitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bassa, bibis vitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:38:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51199.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Woad</hi>, a plant used for dyeing blue: Isatis tinctoria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:117" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 37, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitruvius: <entryFree id="n51200" type="main" key="Vitru_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vitrūvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> M.—Pollio, <sense id="n51200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cœsar and Augustus; author of a work on architecture;</hi> cf. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 259.</sense></entryFree>
vitta: <entryFree id="n51201" type="main" key="vitta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vitta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vieo</etym>, <sense id="n51201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a fillet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi> worn round the head; and, in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a head-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificial</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacerdotal fillet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 538</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:480" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 643</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 118</bibl>.—Represented as worn by poets, a symbol of their sacred office, or, acc. to Serv., in token of divine honors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 665</bibl>.—Also by brides and Vestal virgins, regarded as a symbol of chastity: <cit><quote lang="la">capite compto crinis vittasque habeat, adsimuletque se Tuam esse uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 34; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 386</bibl>.—Bound around the altar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or on sacred trees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 744</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">borne by suppliants for protection or pardon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 237</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:401 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 401 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vittatus: <entryFree id="n51202" type="main" key="vitta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vittātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitta</etym>, <sense id="n51202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bound with a fillet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honos frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitula: <entryFree id="n51203" type="main" key="vi^tu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vitulus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51204" type="main" key="Vi_tu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vītŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of Victory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Exultation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitulamen: <entryFree id="n51205" type="main" key="vi_tu^la_me^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītŭlāmĕn</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vitulor</etym>, <sense id="n51205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sucker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 37, 57</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitularia: <entryFree id="n51206" type="main" key="Vi^tu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭtŭlārĭa via</orth>, <sense id="n51206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a road near Arpinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitulatio: <entryFree id="n51207" type="main" key="vi_tu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vitulor</etym>, <sense id="n51207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public thanksgiving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">other festival</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitulinus: <entryFree id="n51208" type="main" key="vi^tu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vitulus</etym>, <sense id="n51208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a calf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51208.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caruncula,</quote> <trans><tr>a piece of veal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assum,</quote> <trans><tr>roast veal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 9</bibl></cit> and 13.—</sense><sense id="n51208.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (caro), <hi rend="ital">calf's-flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 4</bibl> (where vitulina, <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, is the read. of some edd.).</sense></entryFree>
vitulor: <entryFree id="n51209" type="main" key="vi_tu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vītŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n51209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate a festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep holiday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be joyful</hi> (ante-class. for exulto, gestio): is habet coronam vitulans victoriā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 75 Vahl.): in venatu vitulantes, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 14, 18</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 9 Rib.): pontifex in sacris quibusdam vitulari solet, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi opulento, incluto ... lubens vitulor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bring a thank-offering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitulus: <entryFree id="n51210" type="main" key="vi^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vitŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)talo/s</foreign>, bull; whence Italia; Sanscr. vatsas, calf</etym>, <sense id="n51210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51210.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51210.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bullcalf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 624</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 755</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:299 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 299 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51210.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cow-calf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 29</bibl> and 77.— </sense><sense id="n51210.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51210.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a calf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foal;</hi> of the horse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 164</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the elephant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the whale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51210.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus marinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a sea-calf</tr>, <tr>seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:238" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl>.—Called also simply vitulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 55, 56, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vitumnus: <entryFree id="n51211" type="main" key="Vi_tumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vītumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vita</etym>, <sense id="n51211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god that bestows life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Life-god</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vituperabilis: <entryFree id="n51212" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. vitupero</etym>, <sense id="n51212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blameworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censurable</hi> (very rare, but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod vituperabile est per se ipsum, id eo ipso vitium nominatum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12</bibl></cit>. 40: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit> Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
