vituperabiliter: <entryFree id="n51213" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vituperabilis</etym>, <sense id="n51213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blamably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="2001" /> <cb n="VIVA" /></sense></entryFree>
vituperatio: <entryFree id="n51214" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. vitupero</etym>, <sense id="n51214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censuring; blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vituperation</hi> (either given or received) (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">communi vituperatione reprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>; so (opp. laus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:12" default="NO">3, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:55 al" default="NO">8, 6, 55 al.</bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vituperationem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductus erat in sermonem, invidiam, vituperationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 61</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">140: in vituperationem cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperationem vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse alicui laudi potius quam vituperationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod effugissem duas maximas vituperationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et laudes et vituperationes scribebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51214.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blameworthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blameworthy conduct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperatio atque infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:39:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39, § 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vituperator: <entryFree id="n51215" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vituperator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidos vituperatores confutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperatores mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vitupero: <entryFree id="n51216" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n51216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vituperarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 21</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vitiumparo, qs. to find fault, accuse of a fault; hence, transf.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to inflict censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disparage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vituperate</hi> (class.; syn.: culpo, objurgo, damno). </sense><sense id="n51216.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an mavis vituperarier falso quam vero extolli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notare ac vituperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multimodis cum istoc animo es vituperandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius noster in amicitiā P. Lentuli vituperatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem aut scientiam aut studium quodpiam vituperare propter eorum vitia, qui in eo studio sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 27, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis universam (philosophiam) velit vituperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae, quae a Platone graviter vituperantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Rhodiorum res publica) minime quidem vituperanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: qui caelum vituperant, <hi rend="ital">who find fault with heaven itself</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are satisfied with nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 26</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n51216.2" n="II" level="1"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to render defective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spoil</hi> an omen: <cit><quote lang="la">cur omen mihi vituperat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 59</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51217" type="main" key="vi^tu^pe^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭtŭpĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. vitupero</etym>, <sense id="n51217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vituperator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivacitas: <entryFree id="n51218" type="main" key="vi_va_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vivax</etym>. <sense id="n51218.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Natural vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vital force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenaciousness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">length of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivaciousness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tam angustis terminis tantae multitudinis vivacitas continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:41" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 24, 41, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, praef. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13</bibl>, ext. 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, App. de Mundo, 58, 15.—</sense><sense id="n51218.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Liveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivacity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivaciter: <entryFree id="n51219" type="main" key="vi_va_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vivax <sense id="n51219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vivarium: <entryFree id="n51220" type="main" key="vi_va_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. vivarius, II.</entryFree>
vivarius: <entryFree id="n51221" type="main" key="vi_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivus</etym>, <sense id="n51221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to living creatures.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51221.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: naves, <hi rend="ital">fish-boats</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in which live fish are conveyed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—More freq., </sense><sense id="n51221.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosure in which game</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">are kept alive; a park</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fish-pond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:115" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32, 50, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 55, 81, § 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:308" default="NO">3, 308</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipiant senes, quos in vivaria mittant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>whom they keep under their control in order to get made their heirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivatus: <entryFree id="n51222" type="main" key="vi_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">animated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivid</hi> (Lucretian; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">potestas animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 558</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas cernendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 409</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivax: <entryFree id="n51223" type="main" key="vi_vax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivo</etym>. <sense id="n51223.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tenacious of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long-lived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivacious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n51223.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">phoenix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:625" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 30</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibylla,</quote> <trans><tr>ancient</tr>, <tr>venerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 104</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lux aeterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 132</bibl></cit>).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51223.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, concr. and abstr., <hi rend="ital">lasting long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apium (opp. breve lilium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivaci cespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:397" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus expersque sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 47</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="VIVO" /> </sense><sense id="n51223.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulfura,</quote> <trans><tr>burning briskly</tr>, <tr>inflammable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:420" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacissimus cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: discipuli paulo vivaciores, <hi rend="ital">more lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brisker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, = alacriores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl> Spald.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with liveliness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertractare res mysticas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacius quaerere abdita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 332</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viverra: <entryFree id="n51224" type="main" key="viverra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">viverra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ferret</hi>: Mustella furo, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 55, 81, § 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:47" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 16, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivesco: <entryFree id="n51225" type="main" key="vi_vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vīvisco</orth>), <itype>vixi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n51225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vivo], <hi rend="ital">to become alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51225.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:93" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 39, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:59" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 10, § 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 970</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51225.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to grow lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si utraque (arbor) vixerit,</quote> <trans><tr>if they both grow</tr>, <tr>succeed</tr>, <tr>thrive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolones avulsi arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivicomburium: <entryFree id="n51226" type="main" key="vi_vi^combu_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭcombūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vivus-comburo</etym>, <sense id="n51226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning of people alive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vivide: <entryFree id="n51227" type="main" key="vi_vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vividus <sense id="n51227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vivido: <entryFree id="n51228" type="main" key="vi_vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vividus</etym>, <sense id="n51228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: natos, Mart. Cap. poët. 9, § 912.</sense></entryFree>
vividus: <entryFree id="n51229" type="main" key="vi_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivo</etym>, <sense id="n51229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animated</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.). </sense><sense id="n51229.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 178</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51229.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of pictorial representations, <hi rend="ital">true to the life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:44:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 468</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivi de marmore vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 848</bibl></cit>).—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n51229.3" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">full of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Umber (canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello vivida virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigrammata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:42:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi> (acc. to II.); in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:53" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivificatio: <entryFree id="n51230" type="main" key="vi_vi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vivifico</etym>, <sense id="n51230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivification</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivificator: <entryFree id="n51231" type="main" key="vi_vi^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who makes alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quickener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivifier</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 9</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 3.</sense></entryFree>
vivificatorius: <entryFree id="n51232" type="main" key="vi_vi^fi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭfĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivificator</etym>, <sense id="n51232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">life-giving</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanc. 2, 9, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivifico: <entryFree id="n51233" type="main" key="vi_vi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vivificus</etym>, <sense id="n51233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore to life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivify</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n51233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 234</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Pel. 2:10:33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Pel. 2, 10, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51233.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vivificus: <entryFree id="n51234" type="main" key="vi_vi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n51234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivific</hi> (post-class.), App. Trism. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viviparus: <entryFree id="n51235" type="hapax" key="vi_vi^pa^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭpărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivus-pario</etym>, <sense id="n51235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that brings forth its young alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viviparous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivipari et ovipari pisces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viviradix: <entryFree id="n51236" type="main" key="vi_vi^ra_dix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvĭrādix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vivus-radix</etym>, <sense id="n51236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cutting having a root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a layer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickset;</hi> of the vine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 170</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the rose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivisco: <entryFree id="n51237" type="main" key="vi_visco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. vivesco.</entryFree>
vivo: <entryFree id="n51238" type="main" key="vi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvo</orth>, <itype>vixi, victum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n51238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> syncop. vixet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 118</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. giv-, givami, live; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bi/os</foreign>, life; Goth. quius, living; Germ. quicken; Engl. quick</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have life</hi> (syn. spiro). </sense><sense id="n51238.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51238.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Eho, tua uxor quid agit? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Immortalis est. Vivit victuraque est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valet atque vivit (gnatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo'st hominum qui vivat minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere ac spirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 50, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is demum mihi vivere atque frui animā videtur, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of time: <cit><quote lang="la">et pueri annos octingentos vivont ... Quin mille annorum perpetuo vivont ab saeclo ad saeclum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VIVO" /> 2, 85; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 2, 87: Nemo est tam senex, qui se annum non putat posse vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixi Annos bis centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aufidius vixit ad summam senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:179" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad centesimum annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat Epicurus, jucunde posse vivi, nisi cum virtute vivatur,</quote> <trans><tr>live pleasantly unless we live virtuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīventes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the living</hi> (opp. mortui), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 25</bibl>.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">modice et modeste melius est vitam vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 61, 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamne tibi diu videor vitam vivere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchanalia vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tertia vivitur aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 187</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">et vivere vitem et mori dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 90, § 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:427" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturatum opus,</quote> <trans><tr>lives</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 589</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51238.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To survive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be still alive</hi> (mostly in secondary tenses): <cit><quote lang="la">quas inimicitias si tam cavere potuisset, quam metuere solebat, viveret,</quote> <trans><tr>would be still alive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is jam pridem mortuus est: si viveret, verba ejus audiretis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mustius dixisset, si viveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si viveret Hortensius cetera fortasse desideraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si viveret, mihi cum illo nulla contentio jam maneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti paulum tibi esse etiam nunc morae, quod ego viverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam L. Caesar valeret, Serv. Sulpicius viveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitueram, neminem includere in dialogos eorum, qui viverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinat enim, quae futura fuerint, si Philippus vixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Philippus, si vixisset, facturus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui censor fuisset, vetustissimusque ex iis, qui viverent, censoriis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 22, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tamen vivit. Vivit? Immo vero etiam in senatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: vivis; <cit><quote lang="la">et vivis non ad deponendam sed ad confirmandam audaciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.5" n="2" level="3"> Euphemistically, vixit, <hi rend="ital">he is done with life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he is dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixisse nimio satiu'st jam quam vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.6" n="3" level="3"> Ita vivam, <hi rend="ital">as true as I live</hi>, as a formula of asseveration: <cit><quote lang="la">nam, ita vivam, putavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:11 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51238.7" n="4" level="3"> Ne vivam si, <hi rend="ital">may I not live if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">may I die if;</hi> as a form of asseveration: <cit><quote lang="la">quid poteris, inquies, pro iis dicere? Ne vivam, si scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51238.8" n="5" level="3"> Si vivo, <hi rend="ital">if I live</hi>, a formula of menacing: <cit><quote lang="la">erit ubi te ulciscar, si vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.9" n="6" level="3"> In the phrases, </sense><sense id="n51238.10" n="a" level="4"> Alicui vivere, <hi rend="ital">to live for</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">haec qui misit, non sibi soli postulat Te vivere et suā causā excludi ceteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi soli viveres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: secum vivere, II. B. infra.—</sense><sense id="n51238.11" n="b" level="4"> In diem vivere, <hi rend="ital">from hand to mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the present hour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi, qui in horam viverent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.12" n="c" level="4"> De lucro vivere, <hi rend="ital">a life that is clear gain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the mercy of another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.13" n="C" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n51238.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To live well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live at ease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me cohortaris ad ambitionem et ad laborem, faciam quidem: sed quando vivemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: vivite lurcones, comedones, vivite ventres, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 156:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 156, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 66</bibl>.—Hence, in bidding farewell: <cit><quote lang="la">vive valeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 67 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivite, silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>fare ye well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.15" n="2" level="3"> Like our <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be remembered</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vivet extento Proculeius aevo ... Illum aget Fama superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia saecula famā vivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:879" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 879</bibl></cit>: mea semper gloria vivet, Cic. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitum vivit sub pectore vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirat adhuc amor Vivuntque commissi calores Aeoliae fidibus puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">das nostro nomen victurum amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:441" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 441</bibl></cit>: mihi quidem Scipio, quamquam est subito ereptus, vivit tamen <pb n="2002" /> <cb n="VIVU" /> semperque vivet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivit vivetque semper, atque etiam latius in memoriā hominum et sermone versabitur, postquam ab oculis recessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51238.16" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51238.17" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live</hi> on any thing or in any manner, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to support life; to sustain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">maintain one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpibus palmarum vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscibus atque ovis avium vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte atque pecore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 14: cortice ex arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coriis herbisque et radicibus vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbis Vivis et urticā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliquis et pane secundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suaviter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 56</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 11, 29: rapto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum vivere quidam putant ad cibum pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:234" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 234</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivitur ex rapto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 144</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sunt) in eo studia illa nostra, quibus antea delectabamur, nunc etiam vivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 28</bibl></cit>, a, 2.—</sense><sense id="n51238.18" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass one's life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi> in any place or manner (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam dego): Rhodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cypri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litteris vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximā celebritate atque in oculis civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in paupertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:18:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 18, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in humilitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: cum timore, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unis moribus et numquam mutatis legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenienter naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde familiariter cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirtius vivit habitatque cum Balbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pansā vixi in Pompeiano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis me vivit hodie fortunatior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vivo miserrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viveret in terris te si quis avarior uno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā sorte Contentus vivat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">secum vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>to live for one's self</tr>, <tr>care only for one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam vivitur non cum perfectis hominibus, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vivus: <entryFree id="n51239" type="main" key="vi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n51239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> vivissimus, cited without example by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vivo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has life.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51239.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51239.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n51239.3" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum tantum ausus sit ustor pro mortuo, quid signifer pro vivo non esset ausus? In curiam potissimum abjecit, ut eam mortuus incenderet, quam vivus everterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (simulacrorum) contexta viminibus membra vivis hominibus complent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo ut Cato vix vivus effugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Jugurtham vivom aut necatum sibi tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctus eris vivam (gallinam) musto mersare Falerno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ea Tatio sic erant descripta vivo, tamen eo interfecto multo etiam magis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in the lifetime of Tatius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum illo vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:21" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum leges duo ex unā familiā, vivo utroque, magistratus creari vetarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Cato affirmat, se vivo illum non triumphaturum,</quote> <trans><tr>as long as he lived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">me vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivā me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—So the phrase vivus vidensque, <hi rend="ital">before his very eyes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic acerbissimum vivo videntique funus ducitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Cyprius miser ... vivus (ut aiunt) est et videns cum victu ac vestitu suo publicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et prudens sciens, Vivos vidensque pereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a living man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is, cui forma mortui, fortunae vivi commendatae sunt, ignominiā mortuum, inopiā vivum adfecerit, is inter honestos homines atque adeo inter vivos numerabitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51239.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caespes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:891" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>running</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <trans><tr>fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:778" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernae,</quote> <trans><tr>burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>flint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphur,</quote> <trans><tr>native</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum,</quote> <trans><tr>asbestos-cloth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl>, <cb n="VIX" /> 13: <cit><quote lang="la">calx,</quote> <trans><tr>unslacked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <trans><tr>living</tr>, <tr>natural</tr>, <tr>unwrought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:315" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>quicksilver</tr>, <tr>mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl></cit>: vultus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">alive with expression</hi>, or, as we say, <hi rend="ital">speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 848</bibl>.—So of statues and images: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi artes veterumque manus variisque metalla viva modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: vox, <hi rend="ital">living</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">oral discourse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:33:9" default="NO">33, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 9 al.</bibl>: cujus facta viva nunc vigent, <hi rend="ital">living</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <trans><tr>lively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51239.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, lit., <hi rend="ital">that which is alive;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n51239.6" n="1" level="3"> Ad vivum resecare, <hi rend="ital">to cut to the quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut very deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema pars ipsius unguis ad vivum resecatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. in the <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera circumcidere ad vivas usque partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 43, § 156</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">calor ad vivum adveniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc primum sentio, nisi in bonis amicitiam esse non posse: neque id ad vivum reseco, ut illi, qui haec subtilius disserunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I do not wish to be understood in too strict a sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51239.7" n="2" level="3"> De vivo detrahere or resecare aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take away from the capital</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat de lucro: nihil detraxit de vivo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vivo igitur erat aliquid resecandum, ut esset, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51239.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi> (only post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vivus et ingenuus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivi pectoris homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 103</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a lively manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vive sapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit> Jacob. (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
vix: <entryFree id="n51240" type="main" key="vix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vix</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. from root vic- of vinco</etym>, <sense id="n51240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with much ado</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51240.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quid est, sine his cur vivere velimus? mihi vero cum his ipsis vix; <cit><quote lang="la">his autem detractis ne vix quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vix aut ne vix quidem adpareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix aut omnino non posset ... infirmari sua lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">profluens amnis aut vix aut nullo modo, conclusa autem aqua facile corrumpitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix incedo inanis, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix sum compos animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix me contineo, quin involem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Hic sunt tres minae. <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Vix, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix in ipsis tectis frigus vitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego teneo ab accusando vix me hercule: sed tamen teneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinius collegit ipse se vix, sed collegit tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter angustum et difficile, vix quā singuli carri ducerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi spatio interjecto, vix ut his rebus ... administrandis tempus daretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo, ut vix ulla possit causa reperiri, Quint. Inst. prooem. § 12: ex hominum milibus LX. vix ad D. sese redactos esse dixerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to scarcely five hundred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: carcer vix carcere dignus, Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 19</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vix teneor, quin accurram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix est, ut id obtineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 7, § 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51240.2" n="B" level="2"> Strengthened, </sense><sense id="n51240.3" n="1" level="3"> By <hi rend="ital">aegre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix aegreque amatorculos invenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix et aegre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix et aegerrime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 108, 40; v. aegre.—</sense><sense id="n51240.4" n="2" level="3"> By <hi rend="ital">saltem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vix saltem praecipiendum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.5" n="3" level="3"> By repetition: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus matri vix vixque remissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:167" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of time, <hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51240.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: assum atque advenio Acherunte vix via alta atque ardua, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 208 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ah, vix tandem sensi stolidus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix tandem legi litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contingat vix deinde mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:537" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 537</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.8" n="B" level="2"> With a foll. <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, to denote the immediate succession of two events. </sense><sense id="n51240.9" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix agmen novissimum extra munitiones processerat, cum Galli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix erat hoc plane imperatum, cum illum ... videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ea fatus erat, geminae cum forte columbae ... caelo venere volantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.10" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix primos inopina quies laxaverat artus, Et superincumbens ... liquidas projecit in undas Praecipitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 857</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vix ... et,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 498</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:263" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 263</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ... que,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 692</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.11" n="3" level="3"> With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: vix proram attigerat, rumpit <cb n="VOCA" /> Saturnia funem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 659</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 337</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix bene desieram, rettulit illa mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:278" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 28 sq.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vix bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51240.12" n="C" level="2"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, and usually written in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vixdum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hardly then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcely yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella valde vituperabatur, quod tibi tam cito succederet, cum vixdum triginta dies in Syriā fuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego omnia vixdum etiam coetu nostro dimisso comperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibalem) vixdum puberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum serio adnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressis vixdum quattuor milia passuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 32, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer vixdum libertatem, nedum dominationem modice laturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum dimidium dixeram: intellexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum epistulam tuam legeram, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>, A, 3.—So with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vixdum: <entryFree id="n51241" type="main" key="vixdum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vixdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vix, II. C.</entryFree>
vixet: <entryFree id="n51242" type="main" key="vixet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vixet</orth>, v. vivo <sense id="n51242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vobis: <entryFree id="n51243" type="main" key="vo_bi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōbīs</orth>, <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> of vos; v. tu.</entryFree>
vocabilis: <entryFree id="n51244" type="hapax" key="vo^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voco</etym>, <sense id="n51244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vocal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus vocabilior est visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:30:20:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 30, 20, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocabulum: <entryFree id="n51245" type="main" key="vo^ca_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> of any thing (cf.: nomen, vox). </sense><sense id="n51245.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum habent disciplinae ex ipsis Vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen est, quo suo quaeque (persona) proprio et certo vocabulo appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res suum nomen et proprium vocabulum non habet, ut pes in navi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verborum tanta copia sit in nostrā linguā, res ut omnes suis certis ac propriis vocabulis nominentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus non commutatis immutaverunt vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex more imponens cognata vocabula rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferet in lucem speciosa vocabula rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1042</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaldaei non ex artis, sed ex gentis vocabulo nominati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula tantum pecuniarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nomen neniae: quo vocabulo etiam Graecis cantus lugubres nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberta, cui vocabulum Acte fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex, vocabulo Locusta,</quote> <trans><tr>by name</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa renascentur, quae jam cecidere, cadentque, Quae nunc sunt in honore, vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncta vocabula sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:511" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ululatus, neque enim alio vocabulo potest exprimi theatris quoque indecora laudatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51245.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">a substantive</hi>, both in gen. and as an appellative noun in partic. (in contradistinction to nomen, as denoting a proper name; <cit><quote lang="la">v. nomen): Aristoteles orationis duas partes esse dicit, vocabula et verba, ut homo et equus, et legit et currit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8</bibl></cit>, §§ 11, 12, 45, 52 sq., 80 Müll; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocalis: <entryFree id="n51246" type="main" key="vo_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox</etym>, <sense id="n51246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that utters a voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sonorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vocal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51246.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51246.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves cantu aliquo aut humano sermone vocales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 51, 72, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae (opp. mutae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scarabaei nocturno stridore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 19, 34, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora (vatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 332</bibl></cit>;
