<bibl default="NO">11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha (of Echo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:357" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chordae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <trans><tr>endowed with speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 78</bibl></cit>: genus instrumenti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">slaves</hi> (opp. semivocale and mutum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quem vocalem praeteriisse videamur,</quote> <trans><tr>speaking</tr>, <tr>talking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <trans><tr>in which oracles were given</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:492" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra, Dodonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus signorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocaliora sunt vacua quam plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt aliis alia (verba) jucundiora, vocaliora ... verba e syllabis magis vocalia (corresp. to melius sonantes syllabae),</quote> <trans><tr>more vocal</tr>, <tr>clearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eligere vocalissimum aliquem, qui legeret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the most powerful voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51246.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51246.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (littera), <hi rend="ital">a vowel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:20" default="NO">1, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO">1, 7, 14</bibl>; 1, 7, 26.—</sense><sense id="n51246.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (homines), <hi rend="ital">vocalists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singers</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51246.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: causative, <hi rend="ital">making vocal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inspiring speech</hi> or <hi rend="ital">song</hi> (rare and <pb n="2003" /> <cb n="VOCI" /> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Castaliae vocales undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Pieriis vocalis fontibus unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with a loud cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loudly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocalitas: <entryFree id="n51247" type="hapax" key="vo_ca_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vocalis</etym>, <sense id="n51247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">open sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">euphony;</hi> as transl. of <foreign lang="greek">eu)fwni/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocaliter: <entryFree id="n51248" type="main" key="vo_ca_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vocalis <sense id="n51248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vocamen: <entryFree id="n51249" type="main" key="vo^ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>voco</etym>, <sense id="n51249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> (ante- and postclass. for the class. vocabulum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 657</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 251</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vocates: <entryFree id="n51250" type="main" key="Voca_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vocātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Aquitania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocatio: <entryFree id="n51251" type="main" key="vo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>voco, a calling; hence, in partic.</etym>, <sense id="n51251.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A citing</hi> before a court; <hi rend="ital">a summons</hi>, Varr. and Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 13:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 13, 13, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51251.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bidding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invitation</hi> to dinner, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 47, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51251.2" n="III" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">calling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 3, 1</bibl>: in caelo, Hilar. in Matt. 4, 15.</sense></entryFree>
vocative: <entryFree id="n51252" type="main" key="vo^ca_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vocativus</etym>, <sense id="n51252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the vocative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocativus: <entryFree id="n51253" type="main" key="vo^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voco</etym>, <sense id="n51253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to calling</hi>: casus, <hi rend="ital">the vocative case</hi>, in gram., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 5, 1 sq.</bibl> al.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the vocative case</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 11</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 671</bibl> ib. al.</sense></entryFree>
vocator: <entryFree id="n51254" type="main" key="vo^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.), <sense id="n51254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a caller.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51254.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Paulus vocator gentium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 461; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51254.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a bidder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviter</hi> to dinner, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:85:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 85, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocatorius: <entryFree id="n51255" type="main" key="vo^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vocator</etym>, <sense id="n51255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to calling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invoking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invocatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocatus: <entryFree id="n51256" type="main" key="vo^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>voco</etym>, <sense id="n51256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calling upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invocation</hi> (only <case>abl.</case> in prose). </sense><sense id="n51256.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">et ille et senatus frequens vocatu Drusi in curiam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o numquam frustrata vocatus Hasta meos,</quote> <trans><tr>my call</tr>, <tr>my invocation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51256.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an invitation</hi> to dinner, etc.: misit qui diceret, cenaturum apud Caesarem vocatu ipsius, Suet Calig. 39.</sense></entryFree>
vociferatio: <entryFree id="n51257" type="main" key="vo_ci^fe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vociferor</etym>, <sense id="n51257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:60:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 60, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vociferator: <entryFree id="n51258" type="main" key="vo_ci^fe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cries aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferator</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Joannes in solitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vociferatus: <entryFree id="n51259" type="hapax" key="vo_ci^fe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĕrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loud cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocifero: <entryFree id="n51260" type="main" key="vo_ci^fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĕro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, rare collat. form of vociferor: <sense id="n51260.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">crescere turba et vociferare ex omnibus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 12</bibl>, s. v. vociferor: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vociferant saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferatum ferociter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vociferor: <entryFree id="n51261" type="main" key="vo_ci^fe^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n51261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vox-fero], <hi rend="ital">to cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bawl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferate</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">clamo): vociferari palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventu Gallorum vociferatus est (anser) canibus silentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me dies, vox, latera deficiant, si hoc nunc vociferari velim, quam miserum indignumque sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canuleius pauca in senatu vociferatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendiarium et patinarium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to call aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vociferabare decem millia talentūm Gabinio esse promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65, 3</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 10, 29, 3; 10, 35, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 40</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferans, Q. Vare, legiones redde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferari Decius, quo fugerent? quamve in fugā spem haberent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 12</bibl></cit> (MSS. vociferare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Weissenb. ad loc.).—Of things concr. or abstr.: aera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sound</tr>, <tr>resound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa per se vociferatur,</quote> <trans><tr>proclaims it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1051" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1051</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio naturam rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocifico: <entryFree id="n51262" type="main" key="vo_ci^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n51262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [vox-facio], <hi rend="ital">to cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter a loud cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n51262.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) a se eiciunt fucos, quos vocificantes persequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51262.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cb n="VOCO" /> cujus vim Demosthenis orationes vocificant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocio: <entryFree id="n51263" type="main" key="Vocio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vocio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Norici</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vocito: <entryFree id="n51264" type="main" key="vo^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>voco</etym>. <sense id="n51264.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wont to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">igneus Vertex, quem patrio vocitamus nomine fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (Matrem) variae gentes ... Idaeam vocitant matrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri quidem omnes reges vocitaverunt, qui soli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:27:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 27, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has Graeci stellas Hyadas vocitare suerunt, id. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111: Demetrius qui Phalereus vocitatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vivum eum tyrannum vocitarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lipara antea Melogonis vocitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51264.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call loudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call out</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">clamor accurrentium, vocitantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocivus: <entryFree id="n51265" type="main" key="vo^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏcīvus</orth>, v. vacivus.</entryFree>
voco: <entryFree id="n51266" type="main" key="vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n51266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vocarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 27</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vak-, to say; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">vep:</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">e)/pos</foreign>, word; <foreign lang="greek">ei)=pon</foreign>, said</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to call; to call upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoke; to call together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convoke</hi>, etc. (cf.: appello, compello). </sense><sense id="n51266.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51266.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: (patrem) blandā voce vocabam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 51 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis vocat? quis nominat me?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Vin' vocem huc ad te (patrem)? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Voca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonius magnam jumentorum atque hominum multitudinem ex omni provinciā vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorigem ad se vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum Romanum ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ad concilium classico ad tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in contionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 144</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patribus vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse vocat pugnas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur haec moriens pueris dixisse vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 170</bibl></cit>.— With <case>dat.</case> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">populumque ac senatum auxilio vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 45</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum vocare (sc. patres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 21, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem vocari placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatum vocari jussissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum cornix plenā pluviam vocat improba voce,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>announces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 388</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ventos aurasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1086" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1086</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce vocans Hecaten caeloque Ereboque potentem,</quote> <trans><tr>invoking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios Voce deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 680</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina magna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 264</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 181: auxilio deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos in vota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 234</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 471: vos (deos) in verba,</quote> <trans><tr>as witnesses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vocet divum populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 10</bibl>; 1, 30, 2; 3, 22, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">votis imbrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to call down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 157</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Charon) levare functum Pauperem laboribus Vocatus atque non vocatus audit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51266.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51266.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi> into court, before a magistrate (syn. cito): <cit><quote lang="la">in jus vocas: sequitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 61</bibl></cit>: tribuni etiam consulem in rostra vocari jusserunt, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51266.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi> one as a guest, to dinner, etc. (syn. invito): <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Solus cenabo domi? <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Non enim solus: <cit><quote lang="la">me vocato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis esum me vocat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo ad prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum suam istum non fere quisquam vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos parasiti, quos numquam quisquam neque vocat neque invocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium apparandis nuptiis, vocandi, sacrificandi dabitur paululum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Cenabis apud me. <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Vocata est opera nunc quidem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have been already invited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I have an engagement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, bene vocas! verum vocata res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: bene vocas; <cit><quote lang="la">tum gratia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n51266.6" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me ad vitam vocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nisi vides expediri, quam in spem me vocas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: quarum rerum spe ad laudem me vocasti, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51266.7" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate or abstract subjects, <hi rend="ital">to invite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi>: quo cujusque cibus vocat atque invitat aventes, <cb n="VOCO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 524</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis crepitans vocat Auster in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quāque vo. cant fluctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses fessos nox imberque ad necessariam quietem vocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad studium (feriae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque vocasset defectionis ab Romanis spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: arrogantiā offensas vo care, <hi rend="ital">to provoke</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excite hostility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 80</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipso anni tempore ad gerendum bellum vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare sitim fluvii fontesque vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:945" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 945</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51266.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To challenge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones ... nutu vocibusque hostes, si introire vellent, vocare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hinc Aetoli, haud dubie hostes, vocarent ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare hostem et vulnera mereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 375</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:199" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:747" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 747</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 223</bibl> Heyne ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n51266.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To call</hi> by name, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denominate</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. nomino): certabant urbem Romam Remoramne vocarent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48</bibl>. 107 (Ann. v. 85 Vahl.): quem Graeci vocant Aërem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 65</bibl> Müll. (Epicharm. v. 8 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum penes unum est omnium summa rerum, regen illum unum vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: comprehensio, quam <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyin</foreign> illi vocant, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem ex Antiochi patris nomine Antiochiam vocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Spelaeum, quod vocant, biduum moratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miserum vocares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possidentem multa vocaveris Recte beatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 45</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to name after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis, quem Magneta vocant patrio de nomine Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 908</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrioque vocant de nomine mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 77</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vocor Lyconides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Quī vocare? <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Geta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam lepidus vocor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se visum esse in eo colle Romulum, qui nunc Quirinalis vocatur ... se deum esse et Quirinum vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba longa brevi subjecta vocatur iambus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiens vocari Caesaris ultor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive tu Lucina probas vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be named for</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurini vocantur de fluvio qui propter fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Orig. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> Orig. 3</bibl></cit>, fr. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi, qui de nomine Augusti fastis additi, Augustales vocarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51266.10" n="6" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to call to a knowledge of the gospel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Thess. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51266.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi> in some position or condition: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me apud milites in invidiam voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in odium aut invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusdam familia in suspitionem est vocata conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partem (hereditatis) mulieres vocatae sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>succeeded to a share</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in partem curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portionem muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad Democritum vocas,</quote> <trans><tr>to refer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 56</bibl></cit>.—With inanimate or abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eā die ad hanc diem quae fecisti, in judicium voco,</quote> <trans><tr>I call to account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula verba sub judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calculos vocare amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla fere potest res in dicendi disceptationem aut controversium vocari, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in dubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:28:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa deorum immortalium, tecta urbis, vitam omnium civium, Italiam denique totam ad exitium et vastitatem vocas,</quote> <trans><tr>bring to destruction</tr>, <tr>reduce to ruin</tr>, <tr>destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voconius: <entryFree id="n51267" type="main" key="Vo^co_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏcōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; so, Q. Voconius Saxa, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi> 580 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Lex Voconia, <hi rend="ital">which restricted the right of women to inherit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 107</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:28:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 28, 1</bibl>.— Hence, Forum Voconii, <hi rend="ital">a town in Gaul</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 1</bibl>; Sauppius ap. Orell. Ind. Legum, pp. 294-305, and the authorities there cited.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏcōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Voconius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Voconia pira,</quote> <trans><tr>named after a Voconius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocontii: <entryFree id="n51268" type="main" key="Vo^contii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏcontii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">between the rivers Isara and</hi> <pb n="2004" /> <cb n="VOLA" /> <hi rend="ital">Druentius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vaison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 9</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏ-contĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vocontii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vocontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:467" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 467</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vocula: <entryFree id="n51269" type="main" key="vo_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vox</etym>, <sense id="n51269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble voice</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n51269.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recreandae voculae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51269.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51269.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A soft note</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto molliores sunt et delicatiores in cantu flexiones et falsae voculae quam certae et severae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51269.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty speech; a little word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurrit haec nostra laurus non solum in oculos, sed jam etiam in voculas malevolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significatio hujus voculae (saltem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:14:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voculatio: <entryFree id="n51270" type="main" key="vo_cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vocula</etym>, <sense id="n51270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the intonation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accentuation</hi> of words, <hi rend="ital">accent</hi> (anteclass.), Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25, 3</bibl>, and 13, 6, 1.</sense></entryFree>
vogesus: <entryFree id="n51271" type="main" key="Vo^ge^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏgĕsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Vosegus.</entryFree>
voisgram: <entryFree id="n51272" type="gloss" key="voisgram"><orth extent="full" lang="la">voisgram</orth>, avem quae se vellit. Augures hanc eandem fucillantem appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=371" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 371</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
vola: <entryFree id="n51273" type="main" key="vo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hollow of the hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the palm</hi>, or (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=370" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 370</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">of the foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 204</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 927</bibl>.—Prov.: nec vola nec vestigium apparet or exstat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not the slightest trace</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 416, 19</bibl> and 22.</sense></entryFree>
volaemapira: <entryFree id="n51274" type="main" key="volaema pi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volaema pĭra</orth>, <sense id="n51274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of large pear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warden-pear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 88</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: pirum volaemum, Arat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
volana: <entryFree id="n51275" type="main" key="Volana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44</bibl> and 45.</sense></entryFree>
volandum: <entryFree id="n51276" type="main" key="Volandum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volandum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress of Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volans: <entryFree id="n51277" type="main" key="vo^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of 2. volo.</entryFree>
volaterrae: <entryFree id="n51278" type="main" key="Vo^la_terrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlāterrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Volterra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlāterrā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Volaterrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Volaterran</hi>: Vada, <hi rend="ital">a seaport belonging to the territories of Volaterrœ</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre di Vado</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 24</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlāterrāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Volaterrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Volaterrans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
volatica: <entryFree id="n51279" type="main" key="vo^la_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. volaticus, II. C.</entryFree>
volaticus: <entryFree id="n51280" type="main" key="vo^la_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51280.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51280.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volatile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Academiam volaticam et sui similem, modo huc, modo illuc!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volaticum esse ac levem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Psyche (with fugitiva),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria formae (with temporalia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51280.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning from one to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicari illius furentis et volaticos impetus in se ipsos posse converti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 22, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51280.5" n="C" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n51280.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A witch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorceress</hi>, acc. to Fest. s. v. strigem, p. 314 Müll. —</sense><sense id="n51280.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Witchcraft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorcery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volatilis: <entryFree id="n51281" type="main" key="vo^la_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (class.; cf. ales). </sense><sense id="n51281.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātĭlĕ</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fowl</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia volatilia caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezek. 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne volatile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51281.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51281.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an arrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:970" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 970</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 841</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: cervus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 559, 23</bibl>, and 515, 20 (al. volabile).—</sense><sense id="n51281.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria vanum et volatile quiddam est aurāque mobilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepra,</quote> <trans><tr>changing from one part to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volatura: <entryFree id="n51282" type="main" key="vo^la_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:5" default="NO">8, 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volatus: <entryFree id="n51283" type="main" key="vo^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51283.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilae admonitus volatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer audaci coepit gaudere volatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 223</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:527" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 527</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non si Pegaseo ferar volatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit volatus avibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the power of flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51283.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of any swift motion, <hi rend="ital">rapid course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">velocity</hi>,<cb n="VOLI" />  etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigant. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeris famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps fatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:91:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 91, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volcae: <entryFree id="n51284" type="main" key="Volcae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a numerous and powerful people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">divided into the</hi> Volcae Arecomici <hi rend="ital">and the</hi> Volcae Tectosages, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>; the former had for their chief town Nemausus, the modern <hi rend="ital">Nismes;</hi> the latter, Tolosa, the modern <hi rend="ital">Toulouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volcanus: <entryFree id="n51285" type="main" key="Volca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volcānus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n51285.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fire-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter and Juno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 437</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n51285.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vol-cānĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vulc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vulcanian</hi>: vis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 528, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <trans><tr>a conflagration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 408</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munera, currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemnos,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:313" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51285.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volcānālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vulc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vulcan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vol-cānālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. festa), <hi rend="ital">the yearly festival of Vulcan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the</hi> 23<hi rend="ital">d of August</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:47" default="NO">11, 3, 47</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 489, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 47, § 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51285.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volcanum in cornu conclusum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis Volcanum spargere tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volcentes: <entryFree id="n51286" type="main" key="Volcentes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volcentes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volcentini: <entryFree id="n51287" type="main" key="Volcenti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volcentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Istria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volens: <entryFree id="n51288" type="main" key="vo^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of 1. volo.</entryFree>
volenter: <entryFree id="n51289" type="main" key="vo^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. volo, <sense id="n51289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
volentia: <entryFree id="n51290" type="main" key="vo^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 259, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volesus: <entryFree id="n51291" type="main" key="Vo^le^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlĕsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a powerful Sabine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volgaris: <entryFree id="n51292" type="main" key="volga_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volgāris, volgārĭtas, volgārĭ-ter</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volgātor</orth>, etc., v. vulg-.</entryFree>
volgiolus: <entryFree id="n51293" type="main" key="volgi^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volgĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement for levelling beds of earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volgo: <entryFree id="n51294" type="main" key="volgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volgo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">volgus</orth>, v. vulg-.</entryFree>
volitatus: <entryFree id="n51295" type="main" key="vo^li^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>volito</etym>, <sense id="n51295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi> (late Lat.), Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:223" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volito: <entryFree id="n51296" type="main" key="vo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n51296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [2. volo], <hi rend="ital">to fly to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flit about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flutter</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n51296.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves volitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(volucris) propter humum volitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitant alii (scarabaei) magno cum murmure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51296.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hover about; to flutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">float about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitans totā acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis in millibus ductores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitabit et vagabitur in foro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totā Asiā vagatur, volitat ut rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitare in foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volitat ante oculos istorum Jubae regis filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatum volitant per mare navitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni praefectique cum terrore et armatorum catervis volitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl>. —Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (rerum simulacra) quasi membranae summo de corpore rerum Dereptae volitant ultro citroque per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidissima materiaï Corpora perpetuo volitare,</quote> <trans><tr>hover</tr>, <tr>float about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 952</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of atoms,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra favilla in nimbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae inter vivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tenues animae volitare silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51296.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flutter about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly to and fro</hi>, etc.: nemo me lacrimis decoret nec funera fletu Faxit. Cur? Volito vivu' per ora virūm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl> (Epigr. v. 4, p. 162 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">speremus nostrum nomen volitare et vagari latissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nostri animi ... gestiant ac volitare cupiant vacui curā ac labore,</quote> <trans><tr>to wander about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valebis apud hominem volitantem gloriae cupiditate, vir moderatus et constans,</quote> <trans><tr>soaring</tr>, <tr>aspiring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cupis volitare per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: nec volitabo in hoc insolentius, <hi rend="ital">fly into a passion</hi>, Cic. <cb n="VOLO" /> Fl. 16, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">(Clodius) volitat, furit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Att. 2:22:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volnus: <entryFree id="n51297" type="main" key="volnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volnus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volnĕro</orth>, etc., v. vuln-.</entryFree>
volo: <entryFree id="n51298" type="main" key="vo^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlo</orth> (2<sense id="n51298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">d pers. sing.</hi> vīs, orig. veis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, 1, 6, p. 847</bibl> P.; 1<hi rend="ital">st pers. plur.</hi> volumus, but volĭmus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 89</bibl> Speng.; 3<hi rend="ital">d pers. sing.</hi> volt, and 2<hi rend="ital">d pers. plur.</hi> voltis always in ante-class. writers; <cit><quote lang="la">also volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:53:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 94, § 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl>; 2, 3, 89, § 208; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 30, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl> et saep. —<hi rend="ital">Pres. subj.</hi> velim, but sometimes volim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 44</bibl> Ritschl; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, 1, 8, p. 848</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">so volint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit> Ritschl), velle, volui (<hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> voliturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 712</bibl>; contr. forms, vin for visne, freq. in Plaut. and Ter., also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sis for si vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sultis for si voltis, only ante-class.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. prol. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 11</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. irreg. a.</hi> [Sanscr. var-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bol-, bou/lomai</foreign>; cf. the strengthened root <foreign lang="greek">vel-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">e)e/ldomai, e)/lpomai</foreign>; Germ. wollen; Engl. will], expressing any exercise of volition, and corresponding, in most cases, to the Germ. wollen; in Engl. mostly rendered, <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, and, impersonally, <hi rend="ital">it is my will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">policy</hi> (syn.: cupio, opto;
