but volo properly implies a purpose). </sense><sense id="n51298.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51298.2" n="A" level="2"> With object-infinitive. </sense><sense id="n51298.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To wish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Exire ex urbe priusquam luciscat volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potare ego hodie tecum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quoque volo esse liber: nequiquam volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait rem seriam agere velle mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus enim debet quicunque est velle manere In vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video te alte spectare et velle in caelum migrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid poëtae? Nonne post mortem nobilitari volunt?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si innocentes existimari volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam opinionis meae voluistis esse participes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eas quoque nationes adire et regiones cognoscere volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si velit suos recipere, obsides sibi remittat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominari illi volunt, vos liberi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec relinquere voltis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 58, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam liberi estis, dominari jam in adversarios vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis vestrum suos invisere volt, commeatum do,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim vincere tantum noluit, sed vinci voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem Caesar quibusdam reliquit, neque voluisse se diutius vivere, neque curasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eutrapelus cuicunque nocere volebat, Vestimenta dabat pretiosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Idiomatically: quid arbitramini Rheginos merere velle ut ab iis marmorea illa Venus auferatur? <hi rend="ital">what do you think the Rhegini would take for</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: fabula quae posci vult et spectata reponi, <hi rend="ital">a comedy which wishes</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">is meant</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to be in demand</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim aut hiare semper vocalibus aut destitui temporibus volunt sermo atque epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. 23.—</sense><sense id="n51298.8" n="b" level="4"> Of the wishes of those that have a right to command, the gods, masters, parents, commanders, etc., <hi rend="ital">I want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is my will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in acdibus quid tibi meis erat negoti ... ? Volo scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 18</bibl>; 3, 6, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximā voce clamat populus, neque se uni, nec paucis velle parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuesse deos immortalis, quos pro scelere eorum ulcisci velint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic experiri vim virtutemque volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.9" n="c" level="4"> = in animo habere, <hi rend="ital">to intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac volui inicere tragulam in nostrum senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem quae illis voluisti facere tu, faciunt tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerumque clam voluit exstinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necare candem voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: quid enim ad illum qui te captare vult, utrum <pb n="2005" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> tacentem te irretiat an loquentem? <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis hostem occidere volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 34, 11</bibl>: volui interdiu eum ... occidere; volui, cum ad cenam invitavi, veneno scilicet tollere; <cit><quote lang="la">volui ... ferro interficere (ironically),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum crimen erit, hospitem occidere voluisse,</quote> <trans><tr>the intention to kill your guest-friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:8" default="NO">6, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim vult mori, sed invidiam filio facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Pregn., opp. optare: non vult mori qui optat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eo die is, cui dare volueram (epistulam), non est profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de senectute vellem aliquid scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te volui castigare, tu mihi accussatrix ades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus volo jam ex hoc die esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam a principio amici filiam, Ita ut aequom fuerat, volui uxorem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at etiam eo negotio M. Catonis splendorem maculare voluerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>it was their purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (tumulum) non tam capere sine certamine volebat, quam causam certaminis cum Minucio contrahere,</quote> <trans><tr>his plan was</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lex venditionibus occurrere voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>when it was the purpose of the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: sed quid eā drachumā facere vis? <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Restim volo Mihi emere ... qui me faciam pensilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 87</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Revorsionem ad terram faciunt vesperi. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Aurum hercle auferre voluere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si iis qui haec omnia flammā ac ferro delere voluerunt ... bellum indixi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(plebem) per caedem senatūs vacuam rem publicam tradere Hannibali velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Nolanam in jus dicionemque dare voluerat Poeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: qui (majores nostri) tantā curā Siculos tueri ac retinere voluerunt ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">whose policy it was to protect</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui a principio mitis omnibus Italicis praeter Romanos videri vellet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: idem istuc, si in vilitate largiri voluisses, derisum tuum beneficium esset, <hi rend="ital">if you had offered to grant the same thing during low prices</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92:section=215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92, § 215</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.10" n="d" level="4"> = studere, conari, <hi rend="ital">to try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (i. e. magnas res) qui impedire vult, is et infirmus est mobilisque naturā, et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si quando id (exordium) primum invenire volui, nullum mihi occurrit, nisi aut exile, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:77:315" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 77, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Antonio dico, numquam illum ... nonnullorum de ipso suspitionem infitiando tollere voluisse,</quote> <trans><tr>that he never attempted to remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audes Fatidicum fallere velle deum?</quote> <trans><tr>do you dare attempt?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:262" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.11" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To mean</hi>, of actions and expressions: <cit><quote lang="la">hic respondere voluit, non lacessere,</quote> <trans><tr>the latter meant to answer</tr>, <tr>not to provoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te judices urbi sed carceri reservarunt, neque to retinere in civitate, sed exilio privare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—So, volo dicere, <hi rend="ital">I mean</hi> (lit. <hi rend="ital">I intend to say</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid aliud volui dicere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo autem dicere, illud homini longe optimum esse quod ipsum sit optandum per se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>.—Often with the <case>acc.</case> illud or id, as a correction: <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Specta quam arcte dormiunt. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Dormiunt? <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Illut quidem ut conivent volui dicere, <hi rend="ital">I mean how they nod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 145</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Quid? bracchium? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Illud dicere volui femur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adduxi volui dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 233</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.12" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be going to</hi>: haec argumenta ego aedificiis dixi; nunc etiam volo docere ut homines aedium esse similes arbitremini, <hi rend="ital">now I am going to show how</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 37</bibl>: quando bene gessi rem, volo hic in fano supplicare, <hi rend="ital">I am going to worship here</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quod relicuom restat volo persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustine hoc, Penicule, exuvias facere quas vovi volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinite me prospectare ne uspiam insidiae sint, consilium quod habere volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Prometheus, cum mortalibus ignem dividere vellet, ipse a vicinis carbunculos conrogaret, ridiculus videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait se velle de illis HS. LXXX. cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc se recipere cum vellent, rursus illi ex loco superiore nostros premebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VOLO" /> —</sense><sense id="n51298.13" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be about to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the point of</hi>: quom mittere signum Volt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 88 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens ire volo foras, retines me, rogitas quo ego eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sese in ignem inicere voluit, prohibui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si scires aspidem latere uspiam, et velle aliquem imprudentem super eam adsidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum facere vellent, intervenit M. Manilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum opem ferre vellet, nuntiatum sibi esse aliam classem ad Aegates insulas stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Libys obstantes dum vult obvertere remos, In spatium resilire manus breve vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 676</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 635</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Claudius cum proelium navale committere vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.14" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Will</hi>, and in oblique discourse and questions <hi rend="ital">would</hi>, the auxiliaries of the future and potential: animum advortite: Comediai nomen dari vobis volo, <hi rend="ital">I will give you</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, nisi molestum est, nomen dare vobis volo comediai,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos ite intro. Interea ego ex hac statuā verbereā volo erogitare ... quid sit factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i tu atque arcessi illam: ego intus quod facto est opus volo adcurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 33</bibl>: cum vero (gemitus) nihil imminuat doloris, cur frustra turpes esse volumus? <hi rend="ital">why will</hi> (<hi rend="ital">would</hi>) <hi rend="ital">we be disgraceful to no purpose?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa enim (ars) te, verum si loqui volumus, ornaverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo, si vere aestimare volumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vere aestimare Macedonas, qui tunc erant, volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus me compotem facere potestis, si meminisse vultis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visne igitur, dum dies ista venit ... interea tu ipse congredi mecum ut, etc. ...?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo tibi Chrysippi quoque distinctionem indicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: vis tu homines urbemque feris praeponere silvis? <hi rend="ital">will you prefer</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 92</bibl>; cf. velim and vellem, <hi rend="ital">would</hi>, II. A. 2.—</sense><sense id="n51298.15" n="k" level="4"> Sometimes volui = mihi placuit, <hi rend="ital">I resolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concluded</hi> (generally, in this meaning, followed by an infinitive clause, v. I. B. 4.): <cit><quote lang="la">uti tamen tuo consilio volui,</quote> <trans><tr>still I concluded to follow your advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like to do something</hi>: si sine bello velint rapta ... tradere ... se exercitum domum reducturum, <hi rend="ital">if they were willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">would consent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">would deliver</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is dare volt, is se aliquid posci,</quote> <trans><tr>likes to give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dixit, si hoc de cellā concederetur, velle Siculos senatui polliceri frumentum in cellam gratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:87:section=200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 87, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei laxiorem daturos, si venire ad causam dicendam vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 36, 4</bibl>: nemo invenitur qui pecuniam suam dividere velit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique concessam sibi sub condicione vitam si militare adversus eum vellent, recusarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedere etiam se volebant, si toleranda viris imperarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit> (2, 18), 12.—So with negatives, <hi rend="ital">to be not willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri nemo voluit Sostratam intro admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter verum audire non vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: a proximis quisque minime anteiri vult, <hi rend="ital">likes least to be surpassed</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex his praeter ... accipere voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>refused to accept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.17" n="m" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To do</hi> something <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>: volo facere = meā voluntate or sponte facio: si voluit accusare, pietati tribuo; <cit><quote lang="la">si jussus est, necessitati,</quote> <trans><tr>if he accused of his own free will</tr>, <tr>I ascribe it to his filial love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum statuas voluerint tibi statuere, an coacti sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de risu quinque sunt quae quaerantur ... sitne oratoris risum velle permovere,</quote> <trans><tr>on purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:58:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 58, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere numquam velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—So, non velle with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do something unwillingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with reluctance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere noluit qui mori non vult,</quote> <trans><tr>who dies with reluctance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.18" n="n" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend</hi> (rare with <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> usu. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> v. B. 8.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec tibi scripsi ut isto ipso in genere in quo aliquid posse vis, te nihil esse cognosceres,</quote> <trans><tr>in which you imagine you have some influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc homo luteus etiam callidus ac veterator esse vult, quod ita scribit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>pretends</tr>, <tr>means to be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: sed idem Aelius Stoicus <cb n="VOLO" /> esse voluit, orator autem nec studuit um quam, nec fuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythago. ras, qui etiam ipse augur esse vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.19" n="o" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have no objection to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve of</hi> (cf. E. 1. sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">magis eum delectat qui se ait philosophari velle sed paucis: nam omnino haud placere,</quote> <trans><tr>that he liked</tr>, <tr>had no objection to philosophizing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>; v. also II. A.—</sense><sense id="n51298.20" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi> understood. </sense><sense id="n51298.21" n="a" level="4"> Supplied from a preceding or subsequent clause. </sense><sense id="n51298.22" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is his will</hi>, etc. (cf. 1. a. and b. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc bene vivo et fortunate atque ut volo, i. e. vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>as I wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: quod diu vivendo multa quae non volt (i. e. videre) videt, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde licet quotvis vivendo condere saecla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1090" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1090</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum proficiebam quantum volebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot autem rationes attulit, ut velle (i. e. persuadere) ceteris, sibi certe persuasisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed liceret, si velint, in Ubiorum finibus considere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo praesidio senatus libere quae vellet decernere auderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">neque chorda sonum reddit quem vult manus et mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 348</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.23" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be pleased</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum mihi faciat quod volt magnus Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id repetundi copia est, quando velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit aurum quamdiu voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapiebat et asportabat quantum a quoque volebat Apronius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias quas vellet, quibus vellet, venderet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 39, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens ille tibi potestatem facturus sit ut eligas utrum velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">daret utrum vellet subclamatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum factum est ut plebes praeficeret quaestioni quem vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi materiaeque caedendae unde quisque vellet jus factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 55, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 46, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 25, 5</bibl>; 22, 10, 23; 23, 6, 2; 23, 15, 15; 23, 45, 10; 23, 47, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 21, 11: vicem suam conquestus, quod sibi soli non liceret amicis, quatenus vellet, irasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu quantum vis tolle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.24" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is my purpose</hi>, etc. (v. 1. c. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">sine me pervenire quo volo,</quote> <trans><tr>let me come to my point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi igitur Aristotelio more, quemadmodum quidem volui, tres libros ... de Oratore,</quote> <trans><tr>as I intended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meliore condicione quam quā ipse vult imitetur homines eos qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istos posse vincere scio, velle ne scirem ipsi fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.25" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I will</hi> (v. 1. h. and l. supra): tu eum orato ... <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Sane volo, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube me vinciri. Volo, dum istic itidem vinciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri dic velle (i. e. uxorem ducere),</quote> <trans><tr>that you consent</tr>, <tr>are willing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit> (cf.: si vis, II. A. 2, and sis, supra <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To do</hi> something <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi> (v. 1. m. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">tu selige tantum, Me quoque velle velis, anne coactus amem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.26" n="b" level="4"> With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.27" n="(a)" level="5"> Volo, with a designation of place, = ire volo: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in Formiano morabamur, quo citius audiremus: deinde Arpinum volebamus,</quote> <trans><tr>I intended to go to Arpinum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo mensi Quinctili in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus Vitellius voluerat (i. e. procedere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51298.28" n="(b)" level="5"> With other omissions, supplied from context: volo Dolabellae valde desideranti, non reperio quid (i. e. <hi rend="ital">to dedicate some writing to him</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.29" n="(g)" level="5"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>. 19, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.30" n="3" level="3"> With perfect infinitive active (rare). </sense><sense id="n51298.31" n="a" level="4"> In negative imperative sentences dependent on ne velis, ne velit (in oblique discourse also ne vellet), where ne velis has the force of noli. The perfect infinitive emphatically represents the action as completed (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n51298.32" n="(a)" level="5"> In ancient ordinances of the Senate and of the higher officers (not in laws proper): NEIQVIS EORVM BACANAL HABVISE VELET ... BACAS VIR NEQVIS ADIESE VELET CEIVIS ROMANVS ... NEVE PECVNIAM QVISQVAM EORVM COMOINEM HABVISE VELET ... NEVE ... QVIQVAM FECISE VELET. NEVE INTER SED CONIOVRASE, NEVE COMVOVISE NEVE CONSPONDISE, etc., S. C. de Bacch. 4-13 ap. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 172.—So, in quoting such ordinances: per totam Italiam edicta mitti ne quis qui Bacchis initiatus esset, coisse aut convenisse causā sacrorum velit. <pb n="2006" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> neu quid talis rei divinae fecisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edixerunt ne quis quid fugae causā vendidisse neve emisse vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 17, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.33" n="(b)" level="5"> In imitation of official edicts: (vilicus) ne quid emisse velit insciente domino, neu quid domino celasse velit, <hi rend="ital">the overseer must not buy any thing</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdico, ne extulisse extra aedis puerum usquam velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula praecipue nulla dedisse velis (= noli dare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis humasse velit Ajacem, Atride, vetas? Cur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 187</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.34" n="b" level="4"> In affirmative sentences, implying command (in any mood or tense; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): neminem nota strenui aut ignavi militis notasse volui, <hi rend="ital">I have decided to mark no one</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 11</bibl>: quia pepercisse vobis volunt, committere vos cur pereatis non patiuntur, <hi rend="ital">because they have decided to spare you</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 21, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt delicta tamen quibus ignovisse velimus (= volumus),</quote> <trans><tr>which should be pardoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 347</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.35" n="c" level="4"> To represent the will as referring to a completed action. </sense><sense id="n51298.36" n="(a)" level="5"> In optative sentences with vellem or velim, v. II. B. 5. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, and II. C. 1. b.—</sense><sense id="n51298.37" n="(b)" level="5"> In other sentences (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): ex omnibus praediis ex quibus non hac mente recedimus ut omisisse possessionem velimus, <hi rend="ital">with the will to abandon</hi> (omittere would denote the purpose to give up at some future time), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:1:section=25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 16, 1, § 25</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">an erit qui velle recuset Os populi meruisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me volet incurvasse querelā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.38" n="B" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.39" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wish</hi> (v. A. 1. a.). </sense><sense id="n51298.40" n="a" level="4"> With a different subject: hoc volo scire te: Perditus sum miser, <hi rend="ital">I wish you to know</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos volo consilia vostra vobis recte vortere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emere oportet quem tibi oboedire velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scin' quid nunc te facere volo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si perpetuam vis esse adfinitatem hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul ille egit eas res quarum me participem esse voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim volumus exstingui: jus valeat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi hunc errorem extorqueri volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te scire volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum causarum fuit justissima quod Germanos suis quoque rebus timere voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut equites qui salvam esse rempublicam vellent ex equis desilirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me vivere vis recteque videre valentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vis me flere, dolendum est Primum ipsi tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 102</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pass. inf. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnari tamen omnes volebant,</quote> <trans><tr>that there should be a king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi volo ignosci,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish to be pardoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:28:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 28, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volt sibi quisque credi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.41" n="b" level="4"> With the same subject. </sense><sense id="n51298.42" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi est spes quā me vivere velim,</quote> <trans><tr>what hope have I</tr>, <tr>that I should wish to live?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo me placere Philolachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem esse me, non doctorem volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vult, credo, se esse carum suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 95</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.43" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod certiorem te vis fieri quo quisque in me animo sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ex his minus timidos existimari volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis se causā ... Bacchis initiari velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippae se nepotem neque credi neque dici volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51298.44" n="2" level="3"> Of the will of superiors, gods, etc. (cf. A. 1. b. supra), <hi rend="ital">I want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is my will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me absente neminem volo intromitti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros nostros quibus tu voluisti esse nos matres familias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater illum alterum (filium) secum omni tempore volebat esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deus) quinque reliquis motibus orbem esse voluit expertem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa mittendi fuit quod iter per Alpes ... patefieri volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe (senatus) foedum hominem a republicā procul esse volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (di) patefieri (crimina) ut impunita essent, sed ut vindicarentur voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 32, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus ... Romano sanguini pudicitiam tutam esse voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl>.—So in the historians: <cb n="VOLO" /> quid fieri vellet (velit), after a verbum imperandi or declarandi, <hi rend="ital">he gave his orders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explained his will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri velit praecipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi quid fieri vellet imperabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri vellet ostendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fieri vellet edocuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fieri vellet edixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:24" default="NO">4, 13, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4, 2</bibl>.— Frequently majores voluerunt, <hi rend="ital">it was the will of our ancestors</hi>, referring to ancient customs and institutions: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Cereris summā majores nostri religione confici caerimoniāque voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>: majores vestri ne vos quidem temere coire voluerunt, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 39</bibl>; 23, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 45, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 24, 30</bibl> (10, 20); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl>.—Of testamentary dispositions: cum Titius, heres meus, mortuus erit, volo hereditatem meam ad P. Mevium pertinere, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 277</bibl>. Except in the institution of the first heir: at illa (institutio) non est comprobata: Titum heredem esse volo, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 117</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.45" n="3" level="3"> Of the intention of a writer, etc., <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asinariam volt esse (nomen fabulae) si per vos licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plautus hanc mihi gnatam esse voluit Inopiam,</quote> <trans><tr>has wanted Poverty to be my daughter</tr>, <tr>made her my daughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primumdum huic esse nomen Diphilus Cyrenas voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipsi qui scripserunt voluerunt vulgo intellegi,</quote> <trans><tr>meant to be understood by all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:14:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non hoc intellegi volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale intellegi vult Cicero cum dicit orationem suam coepisse canescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:9" default="NO">9, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam illi (Prometheo) quoque ferreum anulum dedit antiquitas vinculumque id, non gestamen, intellegi voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.46" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To resolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi ... me defensorem calamitatum suarum ... esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si a me causam hanc vos (judices) agi volueritis,</quote> <trans><tr>if you resolve</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus te voluit mihi nummos, me tibi frumentum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (statuā) abjectā, basim tamen in foro manere voluerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">160: liberam debere esse Galliam quam (senatus) suis legibus uti voluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu Macedonas tibi voluisti genua ponere, venerarique te ut deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8</bibl></cit> (7), 13.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n51298.47" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi>: erus meus tibi me salutem multam voluit dicere, <hi rend="ital">has ordered me</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem quem a Labieno occupari voluerit,</quote> <trans><tr>which he had ordered to be occupied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi futuros esse Helvetios ubi eos Caesar ... esse voluisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit> (for velitis jubeatis with <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>, v. II. B. 5. d.).—</sense><sense id="n51298.48" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi> (cf. A. 1. I.): <cit><quote lang="la">obtinuere ut (tribuni) tribuniciae potestatis vires salubres vellent reipublicae esse,</quote> <trans><tr>they prevailed upon them to permit the tribunitian power to be wholesome to the republic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiero tutores ... puero reliquit quos precatus est moriens ut juvenum suis potissimum vestigiis insistere vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere ut eum ... publicae etiam curae ac velut tutelae vellent esse (i. e. senatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare tribunos ut uno animo cum consulibus bellum ab urbe ac moenibus propulsari vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 69, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam superesse causam Romanis cur non ... incolumis Syracusas esse velint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alter ex heredibus voluerit rem a legatario possideri, alter non, ei qui noluit interdictum competet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:1:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 3, 1, § 15</bibl></cit>.—So negatively = <hi rend="ital">not to let</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to suffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum P. Attio agebant ne suā pertinaciā omnium fortunas perturbari vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.49" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion that something should be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluisti enim in suo genere unumquemque ... esse Roscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:61:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>: eos exercitus quos contra se multos jam annos aluerint velle dimitti, <hi rend="ital">he demanded the disbanding of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) vult esse auctoritatem in verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vult esse Celsus aliquam et superiorem compositionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantum irasci vis sapientem quantum scelerum indignitas exigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.50" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion</hi> that something is or was, = censere, dicere, but implying that the opinion is erroneous or doubtful, usu. in the <hi rend="ital">third pers.</hi>, sometimes in the <hi rend="ital">second.</hi> <cb n="VOLO" /> </sense><sense id="n51298.51" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est genus hominum qui esse se primos omnium rerum volunt, Nec sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper auget adsentator id quod is cujus ad voluntatem dicitur vult esse magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis patricius, si quis—quod illi volunt invidiosius esse—Claudius diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.52" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis, opinor, nihil esse ... in naturā praeter ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volunt illi omnes ... eādem condicione nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis evenire omnia fato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri censent, etc., alteri volunt a rebus fatum omne relegari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis a dis immortalibus hominibus dispertiri somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volunt quidam ... iram in pectore moveri effervescente circa cor sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.53" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tam familiaris erat Clodiae quam tu esse vis,</quote> <trans><tr>as you say he is</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit sane tanta quanta tu illam esse vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:55:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 55, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pastum et ad procreandi voluptatem hoc divinum animal procreatum esse voluerunt: quo nihil mihi videtur esse absurdius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 131</bibl>; 2, 46, 142; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 18, 41</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodi ego non fui: me vult fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.54" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To pretend</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi>, both subjects denoting the same person: <cit><quote lang="la">unde homines dum se falso terrore coacti Effugisse volunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 69</bibl></cit> (cf. A. 1. n. supra). (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To mean</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum scientem vultis contra foedera fecisse, an inscientem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam primum istud, quod esse vis?</quote> <trans><tr>what do you mean by as soon as possible?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 24</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Rarely in the <hi rend="ital">first pers.</hi>, implying that the opinion is open to discussion: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et mihi, quae ego vellem non esse oratoris, concederes,</quote> <trans><tr>what according to my opinion is not the orator's province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:17:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 17, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.55" n="9" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51298.56" n="a" level="4"> With things as subjects. </sense><sense id="n51298.57" n="(a)" level="5"> Things personified: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res publica quidem haec pro se suscipi volet,</quote> <trans><tr>would have such things done for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:45:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 45, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tacere grave sit, quod homini facillimum voluerit esse natura,</quote> <trans><tr>which nature willed should be easiest for man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: fortuna Q. Metellum ... nasci in urbe terrarum principe voluit, <hi rend="ital">fate ordained that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>: nihil rerum ipsa natura voluit magnum effici cito, <hi rend="ital">it is the law of nature that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non ingenio voluit natura licere?</quote> <trans><tr>what license did nature refuse to genius?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 68, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me sine, quem semper voluit fortuna jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc me militiam fata subire volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.58" n="(b)" level="5"> Of laws, <hi rend="ital">to provide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim tabulae nocturnum furem ... interfici impune voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex duodecim tabularum tignum aedibus junctum ... solvi prohibuit, pretiumque ejus dari voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:98:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 98, § 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl>, b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, infra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.59" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. pass. inf.</hi>, to represent a state or result wished for. </sense><sense id="n51298.60" n="(a)" level="5"> The <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> being in full, with esse expressed: si umquam quemquam di immortales voluere esse auxilio adjutum, tum me et Calidorum servatum volunt, <hi rend="ital">if it ever was the will of the gods that any one should be assisted</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 1</bibl>: Corinthum patres vestri, totius Graeciae lumen, exstinctum esse voluerunt, <hi rend="ital">it was their will that Corinth should be</hi> (<hi rend="ital">and remain</hi>) <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri ... leges et jura tecta esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:59:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 59, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eam partem epistulae tuae per quam te et mores tuos purgatos et probatos esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">daturum se operam ne cujus suorum popularium mutatam secum fortunam esse vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: for velle redundant in this construction, v. II. A. 2. 3. infra.—With <hi rend="ital">pass. inf. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociis maxime lex consultum esse vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.61" n="(b)" level="5"> With ellips. of esse (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 9</bibl>): perdis me tuis dictis. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Imo, servo et servatum volo, <hi rend="ital">and mean that you should remain saved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aunt qui volum te conventam,</quote> <trans><tr>who want to see you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eidem homini, si quid recte cura tum velis, mandes,</quote> <trans><tr>if you want to have anything done well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed etiam est paucis vos quod monitos voluerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 53</bibl></cit>: id nunc res indicium haeo <pb n="2007" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> facit, quo pacto factum volueris, <hi rend="ital">this shows now why you wished this to be done</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 31</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 30</bibl>, II. B. 1, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, and II. B. 3. b. infra): domesticā curā te levatum volo, <hi rend="ital">I wish to see you relieved</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla sedes quo concurrant qui rem publicam defensam velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex celatum voluerat (i. e. donum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal non Capuam neglectam, neque desertos volebat socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 44, 3</bibl>; 3, 21, 4; 22, 7, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 31, 6: contemptum hominis quem destructum volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te non emptam vellet, emendus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 34</bibl></cit> (so with velle redundant, v. II. A. 1. d., and II. A. 3. infra).—Both subjects denoting the same person: <cit><quote lang="la">velle Pompeium se Caesari purgatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.— Esp., with <hi rend="ital">pass. inf. impers.</hi>: alicui consultum velle, <hi rend="ital">to take care for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advocate somebody's interests</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis consultum volumus propter ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliviscere illum aliquando adversario tuo voluisse consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit> C, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus tribuni plebis nunc consultum repente volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam senatus subventum voluit heredibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">dep. part.</hi>, used passively: <cit><quote lang="la">volo amori ejus obsecutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.62" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">predic. adj.</hi>, without copula. </sense><sense id="n51298.63" n="(a)" level="5"> The subjects being different (mostly aliquem salvum velle): <cit><quote lang="la">si me vivum vis, pater, Ignosce,</quote> <trans><tr>if you wish me to live</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, si me alienus adfinem volet, Tacebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu illam salvam magis velis quam ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ex totā provinciā soli sunt qui te salvum velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:67:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 67, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irent secum extemplo qui rempublicam salvam vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.64" n="(b)" level="5"> Both subjects denoting the same person (virtually = object infinitive): <cit><quote lang="la">in occulto jacebis quom te maxime clarum voles (= clarus esse voles),</quote> <trans><tr>when you will most wish to be famous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo me patris mei similem,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish to be like my father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: ut iste qui se vult dicacem et mehercule est, Appius, <hi rend="ital">who means to be witty</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:60:246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vero se populares volunt,</quote> <trans><tr>who mean to be popular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut integrum se salvumque velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (omne animal) se et salvum in suo genere incolumeque vellet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.65" n="d" level="4"> With an <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> understood. </sense><sense id="n51298.66" n="(a)" level="5"> Velle, <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>: utinam hinc abierit in malam crucem! <hi rend="ital">Ad.</hi> Ita nos velle aequom est (ita = eum abire, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulta es, soror, magis quam volo (i.e. te esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum non quod sentiret, sed quod ego vellem decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim facile est ut irascatur cui tu velis judex (= cui tu eum irasci velis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:45:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.67" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to the will of superiors, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos credo voluisse, nam ni
