vellent, non fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: jamne abeo? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Volo (sc. te abire), <hi rend="ital">so I will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 57</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.68" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi> (v. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">acutum etiam illud est cum ex alterius oratione aliud atque ille vult (sc. te excipere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:67:273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 67, 273</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.69" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi> (v B. 7.): <cit><quote lang="la">veremur quidem vos, Romani, et, si ita vultis, etiam timemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of things as subjects: cadentque vocabula, si volet usus (i. e. ea cadere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 71</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will have</hi> (v. B. 8.): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ego, inimicus, si ita vultis, homini, amicus esse rei publicae debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illi regi tolerabili, aut, si voltis, etiam amabili, Cyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 41</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With ellips. of <hi rend="ital">predic. inf.</hi> (v. A. 2. b.): cras de reliquiis nos volo (i. e. cenare), <hi rend="ital">it is my intention that we dine</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo Varronem (i. e. hos libros habere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.70" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ut ne.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.71" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.72" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To wish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo ut quod jubebo facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia enim id maxime volo ut illi istac confugiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi aedes aliquas conducat volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: hoc prius volo meam rem agere. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Quid id est? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Ut mihi hanc despondeas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 71</bibl>: quid <cb n="VOLO" /> vis, nisi ut maneat Phanium? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim ut tibi amicus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare id quoque velim ... ut sit qui utamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime vellem, judices, ut P. Sulla ... modestiae fructum aliquem percipere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem vellem uti pedes haberent (res tuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ut sit digna puella volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 14</bibl></cit>.—Both subjects denoting the same person: volueram, inquit, ut quam plurimum tecum essem, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 38, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.73" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">It is the will of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi> (v. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">at ego deos credo voluisse ut apud te me in nervo enicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: numquid me vis? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Ut valeas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 120</bibl>: numquid vis? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Dormitum ut abeas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo ut mihi respondeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 18</bibl>; 9, 21; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 29: nuntia Romanis, caelestes ita velle ut mea Roma caput orbis terrarum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.74" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is the purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim</hi>, etc., the two subjects being the same: <cit><quote lang="la">id quaerunt, volunt haec ut infecta faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.75" n="d" level="4"> With other verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">quod peto et volo parentes meos ut commonstres mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero aut populus Romanus hoc voluerit, aut senatus tibi hoc mandaverit ut ... privares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:19:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 19, § 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with opto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with laboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with aequum censere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.76" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ne videas velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc vis? ut opperiare hos sex dies saltem modo, ne illam vendas, neu me perdas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibile est hoc voluisse legumlatorem, ne auxilia liberorum innocentibus deessent,</quote> <trans><tr>intended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.77" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi>: quid nunc tibi vis? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Ut quae te cupit, eam ne spernas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 60</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n51298.78" n="D" level="2"> With subjunct. of dependent verb (mostly ante-class.; class. and freq. with velim and vellem; but in Cic. mostly epistolary and colloquial). </sense><sense id="n51298.79" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo animum advortas volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo amet me patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc volo agatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducas volo hodie uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vis faciam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 65</bibl>; 3, 3, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo etiam exquiras quam diligentissime poteris quid Lentulus agat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonem vincas volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas litteras volo habeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visne igitur videamus quidnam sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: visne igitur descendatur ad Lirim? id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo, inquis, sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.80" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be of opinion that something should be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">require</hi> (v. B. 7.): volo enim se efferat in adulescentiā fecunditas, <hi rend="ital">I like to see</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:21:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo hoc oratori contingat ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.81" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">abi atque obsona, propera! sed lepide volo (i. e. obsones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.82" n="E" level="2"> With object nouns, etc. </sense><sense id="n51298.83" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of a thing. </sense><sense id="n51298.84" n="a" level="4"> With a noun, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like to have</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltisne olivas, aut pulmentum, aut capparim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo male est: aquam velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia videt me suam amicitiam velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: nullam ego rem umquam in vitā meā Volui quin tu in eā re mihi advorsatrix fueris, <hi rend="ital">I never had any wish in my life</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 5</bibl>: (dixit) velle Hispaniam, <hi rend="ital">he wanted Spain</hi>, i. e. as a province, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi frumento non opus est: nummos volo,</quote> <trans><tr>I want the money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non poterat scilicet negare se velle pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit> a, 3; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 32, 2</bibl> (v. II. C. 4. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">si amplius obsidum (= plures obsides) vellet, dare pollicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem etiam qui vincere possunt, volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt (eum) ... honestum finem voluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Scipio veram vellet et sine exceptione victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit> (2, 18), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae munera si voles secundae, Marcentes tibi porrigentur uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.85" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. adjj.</hi>, denoting things, substantively used: utrum vis opta, dum licet. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Neutrum volo, <cb n="VOLO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum isti neutrum volunt,</quote> <trans><tr>acknowledge neither</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluimus quaedam, contendimus ... Obtenta non sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>we aspired to certain things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restat ut omnes unum velint,</quote> <trans><tr>hold one opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si plura velim,</quote> <trans><tr>if I wished for more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quod probemus aliud legislatorem voluisse,</quote> <trans><tr>that the law-giver intended something different</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut putent, aliud quosdam dicere, aliud velle,</quote> <trans><tr>that they say one thing and mean another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum is qui scripsit ... voluerit,</quote> <trans><tr>which of the two was meant by the author</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo contra id quod vult dicit, ita potest melius aliquid velle quam dicit,</quote> <trans><tr>mean better than he speaks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim pudor omnia velle?</quote> <trans><tr>to desire every thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:94:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 94, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.86" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. demonstr.</hi> expressed or understood, <hi rend="ital">to want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo faenus: id primum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximum quod sit bono ... id volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ea quae tu vis volo,</quote> <trans><tr>unless my purpose is the same as yours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem id sapere'st, velle te id quod non potest contingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (i. e. otium cum dignitate) qui volunt omnes optimates putantur,</quote> <trans><tr>who aim at this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatum oportet in re publicā ea velle quae tranquilla et honesta sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est sapientia? Semper idem velle atque idem nolle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudebit eadem velle quae volueras puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 27:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec volo quod cruciat, nec volo quod satiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:57:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 57, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">demonstr.</hi> in place of <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Ithacus velit, et magno mercentur Atridae (sc. poenas in me sumi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc velit Eurystheus, velit hoc germana Tonantis (sc. verum esse, Herculem, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.87" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">interrog. pron.</hi>: quid nunc vis? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Sceleste, at etiam quid velim, id tu me rogas? <hi rend="ital">what do you want now</hi>? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquere quid velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: heus tu! <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Quid vis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 21</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed plane quid velit nescio,</quote> <trans><tr>what his intentions are</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit> a, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittunt etiam ad dominos qui quaerant quid velint,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask for their orders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? Si haec ... ipsius amici judicarunt? Quid amplius vultis?</quote> <trans><tr>what more do you require</tr>, <tr>will you have?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:65:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 65, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatur quid voluerit scriptor,</quote> <trans><tr>we find out the author's intention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes quid vult = quid sibi vult (v. 4. b.), <hi rend="ital">to mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capram illam suspicor jam invenisse ... quid voluerit,</quote> <trans><tr>what it signified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen intellego quid velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem volunt ea di immortales significantes quae sine interpretibus non possimus intellegere? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>.—Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ensem mittit tibi ... Et jubet ex merito scire quid iste velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.88" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod volui, ut volui, impetravi ... a Philocomasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod frons velit oculi sciant,</quote> <trans><tr>that the eyes know what the forehead wants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi quae volo concedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield to him my wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illud quod volumus dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>what we like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa eveniunt homini quae volt, quae nevolt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam (litterae tuae) semper aliquid adferunt quod velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vellem quaeque sentirem dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti ea quae vellent impetrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis animi ad id quod tam diu vellent,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry out what they had desired so long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quod volebant non ... expediebant,</quote> <trans><tr>their purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 23, 9</bibl></cit>. —Idiomatically: quod volo = quod demonstrare volo, <hi rend="ital">what I intend to prove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod volumus expressum est, ut vaticinari furor vera soleat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis sumpsit quod voluit,</quote> <trans><tr>he has twice begged the question</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 52, 107</bibl></cit>.—With indef. relations: <cit><quote lang="la">cornucopia ubi inest quidquid volo,</quote> <trans><tr>whatever I wish for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar de Bruto solitus est dicere: magni refert hic quid velit, sed quidquid volt, valde volt,</quote> <trans><tr>whatever he wills he wills strongly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.89" n="f" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">indef. pronn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.90" n="(a)" level="5"> Si quid vis, <hi rend="ital">if you want any thing</hi>: illo praesente mecum agito si quid voles, <pb n="2008" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 72</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Adeat si quid volt. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Si quid vis, adi, mulier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eumque Alexander cum rogaret, si quid vellet, ut diceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51298.91" n="(b)" level="5"> Nisi quid vis, <hi rend="ital">unless you wish to give some order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make some remark</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego eo ad forum nisi quid vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc de ratione videamus, nisi quid vis ad haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.92" n="(g)" level="5"> Numquid vis or ecquid vis? <hi rend="ital">have you any orders to give?</hi> a formula used by inferiors before leaving their superiors; cf. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visunt, quid agam, ecquid velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid vis aliud?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid vellem rogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentia rogantium num quid vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavit num quid in Sardiniam vellet. Te puto saepe habere qui num quid Romam velis quaerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.93" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi>: aliquem velle. </sense><sense id="n51298.94" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To want somebody</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in order to see him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak with him</hi> (ante-class. and colloq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Demenaetum volebam,</quote> <trans><tr>I wanted</tr>, <tr>wished to see</tr>, <tr>Demenœtus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona femina et malus masculus volunt te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus te solum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non est intus quem ego volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae oves volunt vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me volt? Perii, pater est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones trium cohortium me velle postridie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—With paucis verbis or paucis, <hi rend="ital">for a few words</hi> (<hi rend="ital">moments</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">volo te verbis pauculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed paucis verbis te volo, Palaestrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sosia, Adesdum, paucis te volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.95" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like somebody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be fond of somebody</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc volo (= amo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me amare unum Argyrippum ... quem volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom quae te volt, eamdem tu vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quae (vitia) corpori' sunt ejus siquam petis ac vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam volui nota fit arte meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 60</bibl></cit>: nolo virum, facili redimit qui sanguine famam: hunc volo, laudari qui sine morte potest, <hi rend="ital">I like the one who</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.96" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To wish to have</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">roga, velitne an non uxorem,</quote> <trans><tr>whether he wishes to have his wife or not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sapiens velit gerere rem publicam, atque ... uxorem adjungere, et velle ex eā liberos (anacoluth.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With two accusatives: (narrato) illam te amare et velle uxorem,</quote> <trans><tr>that you wish to have her as your wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.97" n="3" level="3"> With two accusatives, of the person and the thing: aliquem aliquid velle, <hi rend="ital">to want something of somebody</hi> (cf.: aliquem aliquid rogare; mostly ante-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): numquid me vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">face certiorem me quid meus vir me velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quidpiam me vis aliud?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc verba in pauca conferam quid te velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrabit ultro quid sese velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me voluisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid aliud me vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu uno verbo dic quid est quod me velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ille se velit, illum ad se venire oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mirabundus quidnam (Taurea) sese vellet, resedisset Flaccus, Me quoque, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 11</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">I want to speak with</hi> somebody (v. 2. a. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">paucis, Euclio, est quod te volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod te volo secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.98" n="4" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of thing and <case>dat.</case> of the person: aliquid alicui velle, <hi rend="ital">to wish something to somebody</hi> (= cupio aliquid alicui; v. cupio; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): quamquam vobis volo quae voltis, mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex me illa liberos vellet sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium velle se senectuti suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est mali quod illa non initio filio voluerit, optaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Romanam huc provectam ut externis quoque gentibus quietem velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ego omnia meritissimo volo et debeo,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom I give and owe my best wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in the phrase quid vis (vult) with <hi rend="ital">reflex. dat.</hi> of interest, lit. <hi rend="ital">what do you want for yourself?</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.99" n="a" level="4"> Quid tibi vis = quid <cb n="VOLO" /> vis, the <case>dat.</case> being redundant (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid aliud tibi vis?</quote> <trans><tr>what else do you want?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quisque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ita vitam agerent ut nunc plerumque videmus Quid sibi quisque velit nescire,</quote> <trans><tr>be ignorant as to their own aims and purposes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1058" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1058</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.100" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">What do you mean? what do you drive at? what is your scope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drift</hi> (rare in post-Aug. writers; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 45</bibl>, declares it an archaism). </sense><sense id="n51298.101" n="(a)" level="5"> In 1<hi rend="ital">st pers.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quid processerim huc, et quid mihi voluerim dicam,</quote> <trans><tr>and what I meant thereby</tr>, <tr>what was the purpose of my coming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi volui? quid mihi nunc prodest bona voluntas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:21:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.102" n="(b)" level="5"> In 2<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc tibi vis, mulier, memora,</quote> <trans><tr>what is the drift of your talk?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: sed quid nunc tibi vis? <hi rend="ital">what do you want to come at</hi> (i.e. by your preamble)? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 24</bibl>: quid tu tibi vis? Ego non tangam meam? <hi rend="ital">what do you mean?</hi> i. e. what is your purpose? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi vis? quid cum illā rei tibi est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod sic gestis? quid sibi hic vestitus quaerit? Quid est quod laetus sis? quid tibi vis?</quote> <trans><tr>what do you mean by all this?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, inepta? quid vis tibi? quid rides?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vis tibi? Quid quaeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Fabulae! <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quid vis tibi? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roganti ut se in Asiam praefectum duceret, Quid tibi vis, inquit, insane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:67:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 67, 269</bibl></cit>; so in 2<hi rend="ital">d pers. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum fidem, quid vobis vultis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.103" n="(g)" level="5"> In 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid igitur sibi volt pater? cur simulat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hic volt veterator sibi?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde desinant aliquando me isdem inflare verbis: quid sibi iste vult? ... Cur ornat eum a quo desertus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi vellet (Caesar)? cur in suas possessiones veniret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere in eum oculos, mirantes quid sibi vellet (i. e. by courting the plebeians),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quaererent quid sibi vellent qui armati Aventinum obsedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi voluit providentia quae Aridaeum regno imposuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: volt, non volt dare Galla mihi, nec dicere possum quod volt et non volt, quid sibi Galla velit, Mart: 3, 90, 2.—</sense><sense id="n51298.104" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">what means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">what signifies?</hi> quid volt sibi, Syre, haec oratio? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pernoscatis quid sibi Eunuchus velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. prol. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo illae sibi statuae equestres inauratae volunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid haec sibi horum civium Romanorum dona voluerunt?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">186: avaritia senilis quid sibi velit, non intellego,</quote> <trans><tr>what is the meaning of the phrase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo illa sibi vult pars altera orationis quā Romanos a me cultos ait?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitae quid vult sibi noctis imago?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 473</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.105" n="5" level="3"> Bene or male alicui velle, <hi rend="ital">to wish one well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dislike one</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Bene volt tibi. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Nequam est illud verbum bene volt, nisi qui bene facit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:37 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 37 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu ego huic bene et hic mihi volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi, dum vivam, bene velim plus quam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egone illi ut non bene vellem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quod tibi bene ex animo volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tibi male volt maleque faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque isti etiam parum male volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam sic sient qui mihi male volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi male vult,</quote> <trans><tr>he does not dislike himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38</bibl></cit>; so, melius or optime alicui velle, <hi rend="ital">to like one better</hi> or <hi rend="ital">best</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec est quisquam mihi aeque melius quoi vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi ego ex omnibus optime volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—And bene velle = velle: bene volueris in precatione augurali Messalla augur ait, significare volueris, Fest. s. v. bene sponsis, p. 351.—</sense><sense id="n51298.106" n="6" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: alicujus causā velle, <hi rend="ital">to like one for his own sake</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">personally</hi>, a Ciceronian phrase, probably inst. of omnia alicujus causā velle; lit. <hi rend="ital">to wish every thing</hi> (i.e. <hi rend="ital">good</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in somebody's behalf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.107" n="(a)" level="5"> With omnia expressed: etsi mihi videor intellexisse cum tecum de re M. Annaeii locutus sum, te ipsius causā vehementer omnia velle, tamen, etc. ... ut non dubitem quin magnus cumulus accedat commenda <cb n="VOLO" /> tionis meae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 55, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente coepit dicere, se omnia Verris causā velle,</quote> <trans><tr>that he had the most friendly disposition towards Verres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:26:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit eo quod Varro magnopere ejus causā vult omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.108" n="(b)" level="5"> Without omnia: <cit><quote lang="la">per eos qui nostrā causā volunt, valentque apud illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed et Phameae causā volebam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi te ipsius Attici causā velle intellexeram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">valde enim ejus causā volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud non perficis quo minus tuā causā velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 7, 1: si me velle tuā causā putas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis causa si qui sunt qui velint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo tuā causā velle Lentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl>; cf. id. Imp. Pomp. (v. C. 1. b. supra), where the phrase has its literal meaning; cf. also: alicujus causā (omnia) cupere; v. cupio.—</sense><sense id="n51298.109" n="7" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">subjunct.</hi> per ecthesin (ante-class.): nunc ego illum meum virum veniat velim (by mixture of constructions: meum virum velim; and: <cit><quote lang="la">meus vir veniat velim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego Simonidem mi obviam veniat velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis hercle ego illum corvum ad me veniat velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem aliquem velim qui mihi ex his locis viam monstret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem atque matrem viverent vellem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 30</bibl> (v. E. 1. d. supra).</sense><sense id="n51298.110" n="F" level="1"> Velle used absolutely, variously rendered <hi rend="ital">to will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vos, malum ... me sic ludificamini? Nolo volo, volo nolo rursum,</quote> <trans><tr>I nill I will</tr>, <tr>I will I nill again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: novi ingenium mulierum: Nolunt ubi velis, ubi nolis cupiunt ultro, <hi rend="ital">they will not where you will</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est cui velle non liceat?</quote> <trans><tr>who is not free to wish?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnis et voluisse sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 1), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">tarde velle nolentis est,</quote> <trans><tr>slow ness in consenting betrays the desire to refuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (animalia) nullam injuriam nobis faciunt, quia velle non possunt, id. Ira, 2, 26, 4: ejus est nolle qui potest velle,</quote> <trans><tr>the power to assent implies the power to dissent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—So velle substantively: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego hoc ipsum velle miserius duco quam in crucem tolli,</quote> <trans><tr>that very wishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: inest enim velle in carendo, <hi rend="ital">the word</hi> carere <hi rend="ital">implies the notion of a wish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velle ac posse in aequo positum erat,</quote> <trans><tr>his will and power were balanced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">velle tuum nolo, Didyme, nolle volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:83:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 83, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velle suum cuique est,</quote> <trans><tr>each has his own likings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:53" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.111" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51298.112" n="A" level="2"> Redundant, when the will to do is identified with the act itself. </sense><sense id="n51298.113" n="1" level="3"> In imperative sentences. </sense><sense id="n51298.114" n="a" level="4"> In independent sentences introduced by noli velle, where noli has lost the idea of volition: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite, judices, hunc velle maturius exstingui vulnere vestro quam suo fato,</quote> <trans><tr>do not resolve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite igitur id velle quod fieri non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: qui timor bonis omnibus injectus sit ... nolite a me commoneri velle, <hi rend="ital">do not wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be reminded by me</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 25, 50</bibl>: nolite hunc illi acerbum nuntium velle perferri, <hi rend="ital">let it not be your decision that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl>: cujus auspicia pro vobis experti nolite adversus vos velle experiri, <hi rend="ital">do not desire</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli adversum eos me velle ducere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.115" n="b" level="4"> Ne velis or ne velit fecisse = ne feceris, or ne facito (v. I. A. 3. a. supra).—So ne velis with <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve, revertendi liber, abesse velis (= neve abfueris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.116" n="c" level="4"> In affirmative imperative sentences (velim esse = esto; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): tu tantum fida sorori Esse velis (= fida esto or sis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 745</bibl></cit>; and in 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di procul a cunctis ... Hujus notitiam gentis habere velint (= habeant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere modo qui discet velit (= credat qui discet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. 12. —</sense><sense id="n51298.117" n="d" level="4"> In clauses dependent on verbs of commanding and wishing: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quia significant divam praedicere ut armis Ac virtute velint patriam defendere terram (= ut defendant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 641</bibl></cit>: precor quaesoque ne ante oculos patris facere et pati omnia infanda velis (= facias et patiaris). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monentes ne experiri vellet imperium cujus vis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mea ... opto Vulnera qui fecit facta levare velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: nos contra (oravimus) <pb n="2009" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> ... ne vertere secum Cuncta pater fatoque urguenti incumbere vellet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 653</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">pass. perf. inf.</hi> (v. I. B. 9. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">legati Sullam orant ut filii innocentis fortunas conservatas velit (virtually = fortunas conservet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te peto ut utilitatem sociorum per te quam maxime defensam et auctam velis (= defendas et augeas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—So after <hi rend="ital">utinam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam illi qui prius eum viderint me apud eum velint adjutum tantum quantum ego vellem si quid possem (= utinam illi me adjuvent quantum ego adjuvarem, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautius ut saevo velles te credere Marti (= utinam te credidisses),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum praemittit ad quam diem magistratus ... sibi esse praesto Cordubae vellet (= sibi praesto essent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit> (cf. also I. B. 9. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, and I. B. 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.118" n="2" level="3"> In conditional clauses, si facere velim = si faciam, often rendered by the potential or future auxiliaries <hi rend="ital">would</hi> or <hi rend="ital">will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu scis, Bacchae bacchanti si velis advorsarier, ex insanā insaniorem facies? (= si advorseris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si meum Imperium exsequi voluisset, interemptam oportuit (= si executus esset),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id confiteri velim, tamen istum condemnetis necesse est (= si id confitear),</quote> <trans><tr>if I would acknowledge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis velit ita dicere ... nihil dicat (= si quis dicat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies deficiat si velim numerare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in sententiā si constare voluissent, suam auctoritatem ... recuperassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere potestis, si recordari volueritis quanta, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>if you will remember</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:44:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 44, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si audire voletis externa, maximas res publicas ab adulescentibus labefactatas reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:60:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 60, 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus me compotem voti vos facere potestis, si meminisse vultis, non vos in Samnio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 15, 4</bibl>: cum olera Diogeni lavanti Aristippus dixisset: si Dionysium adulare velles, ista non esses; <cit><quote lang="la">Imo, inquit, si tu ista esse velles, non adulares Dionysium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si his (legibus) perpetuo uti voluissent, sempiternum habituri fuerint imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim si mirari velit, non in silvestribus dumis poma pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:6" default="NO">3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl> (18), 43.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ea (opera) certi auctores monumentis suis testata esse voluissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.119" n="3" level="3"> In declarative sentences. </sense><sense id="n51298.120" n="a" level="4"> Volo in 1<hi rend="ital">st pers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">perf. pass. inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> (volo oratum esse or oratum = oro; v. I. B. 9. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">vos omnes opere magno esse oratos volo benigne ut operam detis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justam rem et facilem esse oratam a vobis volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud tamen te esse admonitum volo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed etiam est paucis vos quod monitos voluerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud te, Tulli, monitum velim etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem omnes eos oratos volo Ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 26</bibl></cit>; so, factum volo = faciam: serva tibi sodalem, et mihi filium. <hi rend="ital">Mne.</hi> Factum volo, <hi rend="ital">I will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 91</bibl>: pariter nunc opera me adjuves ac, etc. <hi rend="ital">Nau.</hi> Factum volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 10</bibl>.—In 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse salutatum vult te mea littera primum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.121" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea te vocari ad cenam volo (= voco te),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nunc rogare hoc ego vicissim te volo: quid fuit, etc. (= nunc te rogo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.122" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. act. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace tuā dixisse velim (= pace tuā dixerim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.123" n="d" level="4"> In other connections, when the will or purpose is made more prominent than the action: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum alter, qui Antiochus vocatur, iter per Siciliam facere voluit (= fecit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si suscipere eam (religionem) nolletis, tamen in eo qui violasset sancire vos velle oporteret (= sancire vos oporteret),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">114: ut insequentibus diebus nemo eorum forum aut publicum adspicere vellet (= adspiceret),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentis mille percussorem in me emere voluisti (= emisti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: quin etiam senatus gratias ei agentem quod redire voluisset ante portas eduxit (= quod redisset),<cb n="VOLO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utri prius gratulemur, qui hoc dicere voluit, an cui audire contigit? (= qui hoc dixit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tua non paucae carpere facta volent (= carpent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.124" n="B" level="2"> Velim, as potential subjunctive (mostly in 1<hi rend="ital">st pers. sing.</hi>, as subjunctive of modest statement), = volo, <hi rend="ital">I wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I should like.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.125" n="1" level="3"> With verb in the second person. </sense><sense id="n51298.126" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>, so most frequently in Cic. </sense><sense id="n51298.127" n="(a)" level="5"> As a modest imperative of the dependent verb: velim facias = fac, <hi rend="ital">I wish you would do it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">please do it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quae in rem tuam sint, ea velim facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas (litteras) in eundem fasciculum velim addas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum salvere jubeas velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim me facias certiorem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim saepe ad nos scribas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mihi ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 75, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim animum a me parumper avertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 3, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pro causā meā dicta accipiatis velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: velim, inquit, hoc mihi probes, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musa velim memores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.128" n="(b)" level="5"> Expressing a wish without a command (v. vellem): <cit><quote lang="la">vera dicas velim,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish you told the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam velim Bruto persuadeas ut Asturae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse velim poenas experiare meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 74</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in asseverations: ita velim me promerentem ames, dum vivas, mi pater, ut ... id mihi vehementer dolet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51298.129" n="b" level="4"> With infinitive clause. </sense><sense id="n51298.130" n="(a)" level="5"> With the force of a modest imperative: <cit><quote lang="la">sed qui istuc credam ita esse, mihi dici velim (i. e. a te),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum illud est quod mihi abs te responderi velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 17, 41</bibl></cit> (may be a dependent subjunctive): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque vos ego, milites, non eo solum animo .... pugnare velim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51298.131" n="(b)" level="5"> As a mere wish: <cit><quote lang="la">velim te arbitrari, frater, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum te arbitrari id quod res est velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc te quoque ad ceteras tuas eximias virtutes, Masinissa, adjecisse velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 8</bibl> (v. II. A. 3. a. supra).— </sense><sense id="n51298.132" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">de tuis velim ut eo sis animo, quo debes esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.133" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 23</bibl> (v. I. C. 2. supra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.134" n="2" level="3"> With dependent verb in the third person, expressing a wish. </sense><sense id="n51298.135" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se defatigent velim Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Cicerone quae mihi scribis, jucunda mihi sunt: velim sint prospera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim seu Himilco, seu Mago respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint haec vera velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla me velim syllaba effugiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">final clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim mihi ad urbem praesto sis, ut tuis consiliis utar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 11, 2</bibl> (v. I.
