C. 2. supra).—With ellips. of <hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mehercule Asturae Brutus (i. e. sit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.136" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> (a wish referring to the past): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis velim improbissumo homini malas edentaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.137" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego nunc mihi modium mille esse argenti velim!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: di me perdant! <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quodcunque optes, velim tibi contingere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim eum tibi placere quam maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:249" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 71, 249</bibl></cit>: idque primum ita esse velim; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde etiam, si non sit, mihi persuaderi tamen velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod faxitis, deos velim fortunare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. pass. inf.</hi> (v. I. B. 9. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra): <cit><quote lang="la">edepol te hodie lapide percussum velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribus praefectum mulierum hunc factum velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium plus quam velim nostrorum ingenia sunt mobilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.138" n="3" level="3"> With verb in the first person. </sense><sense id="n51298.139" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc velim probare omnibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim scire ecquid de te recordere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare te, ut polliceris, videre plane velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero velim ... a calce ad carceres revocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed multitudo ea quid animorum ... habeat scire velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare tamen velim, an Isocrates Attice dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">perf. inf. act.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 9</bibl> (v. II. A. 3. c.).— </sense><sense id="n51298.140" n="b" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod velis, modo id velim me scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—So with <cb n="VOLO" /> <hi rend="ital">perf. pass. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego praeterquam quod nihil haustum ex vano velim, Fabium ... potissimum auctorem habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51298.141" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo velim tam facili uti possim et tam bono in me quam Curione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 10</bibl></cit> B. and K. ex conj. Müll. (Lachm., Hoffm. posse; al. possem).—</sense><sense id="n51298.142" n="4" level="3"> Velim in the principal sentence of conditional clauses, <hi rend="ital">I would</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I should be willing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem velim servire, Libanum ut (= si) conveniam modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim, si fieri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tibi compendi facere possim, factum edepol velim (redundant),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si possim, velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec velim (imitari orationes Thucydidis) si possim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si liceat, nulli cognitus esse velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.143" n="5" level="3"> The other persons of velim in potential use (rare). </sense><sense id="n51298.144" n="a" level="4"> Velis. </sense><sense id="n51298.145" n="(a)" level="5"> Imperatively = cupito: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam non potest fieri quod vis, Id velis quod possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque aliquos tamen esse velis tibi, alumna, penates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 331</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.146" n="(b)" level="5"> Declaratively with <hi rend="ital">indef. subj.</hi>: quom inopia'st, cupias; quando ejus copia'st, tum non velis, <hi rend="ital">then you</hi> (i.e. <hi rend="ital">people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>) <hi rend="ital">do not want it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 45</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51298.147" n="(g)" level="5"> Redundant, as a form of the imperative of the dependent verb, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 38</bibl> (v. I. A. 3. a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. b.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 746</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. c.).—</sense><sense id="n51298.148" n="b" level="4"> Velit. </sense><sense id="n51298.149" n="(a)" level="5"> Modestly for vult: <cit><quote lang="la">te super aetherias licentius auras Haud pater ille velit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 558</bibl></cit>: nemo enim minui velit id in quo maximus fuit, <hi rend="ital">would like that to be diminished in which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 104</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 7</bibl> (v. I. E. 1. c. supra).— So, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, instead of vellet with <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fiat, quid non illa dedisse velit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.150" n="(b)" level="5"> = imperative of third person: <cit><quote lang="la">arma velit, poscatque simul rapiatque juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 340</bibl></cit>.—Redundantly, giving to the dependent verb the force of an imperative, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. 12 (v. II. A. 1. c. supra; v. also I. A. 3. a. supra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.151" n="c" level="4"> Velimus. </sense><sense id="n51298.152" n="(a)" level="5"> In the optative sense of velim: <cit><quote lang="la">sed scire velimus quod tibi nomen siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.153" n="(b)" level="5"> With imperative sense (= <hi rend="ital">let us</hi>, <hi rend="ital">we should</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 28</bibl> (v. I. A. 2. d. supra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.154" n="d" level="4"> Velitis = velim velitis (i. e. jubeatis, jubete): <cit><quote lang="la">novos consules ita cum Samnite gerere bellum velitis ut omnia ante nos bella gesta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—So especially in velitis jubeatis, a formula in submitting a law to the votes of the people in the comitia centuriata or tributa, <hi rend="ital">let it be resolved and ordered by you</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatus in haec verba populus: velitis jubeatisne haec sic fieri, si respublica populi Romani Quiritium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velitis jubeatis, Quirites ... uti de eā re Ser. Sulpicius praetor urbanus ad senatum referat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 54, 3</bibl></cit>.—And parodied by Cic.: <cit><quote lang="la">velitis jubeatis ut quod Cicero versum fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 29, 72</bibl></cit>.—So in oblique discourse, vellent juberent: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem promulgavit, vellent juberent Philippo ... bellum indici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellent juberentne se regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the resolution of the people: plebis sic jussit: quod senatus ... censeat, id volumus jubemusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 33, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.155" n="e" level="4"> Velint, optative and redundant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 7</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. d.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 7, 8</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. c.).</sense><sense id="n51298.156" n="C" level="2"> Vellem, as potential subjunctive, <hi rend="ital">I wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">should like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">should have liked</hi>, representing the wish as contrary to fact, while velim refers to a wish which may be realized: <cit><quote lang="la">de Menedemo vellem verum fuisset, de reginā velim verum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>. It is not used with imperative force; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribis, putare te ... vellem scriberes, cur ita putares ... tu tamen velim scribas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—Often quam vellem, <hi rend="ital">how I wish</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I wish very much;</hi> and in the same sense: nimium vellem, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. </sense><sense id="n51298.157" n="1" level="3"> With verb in first person. </sense><sense id="n51298.158" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">would like</hi>, referring to present or future actions: <cit><quote lang="la">videre equidem vos vellem, cum huic aurum darem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem equidem idem posse gloriari quod Cyrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem equidem vobis placere, Quirites, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam fieri vellem meus libellus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:72:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 72, 9</bibl></cit>.—With cuperem and optarem: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego Triptolemi cuperem conscendere currus ... Nunc ego Medeae vellem frenare dracones ... Nunc ego jactandas optarem sumere pennas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.— <pb n="2010" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> Rarely, <hi rend="ital">I should have liked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum equidem istuc os tuum inpudens videre nimium vellem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 49</bibl></cit>.—And in conditional sense: <cit><quote lang="la">maerorem minui: dolorem nec potui, nec, si possem, vellem (i. e. minuere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe ego, si sineres, titulum tibi reddere vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic nec amari quidem vellem (i. e. if I were in his place),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:20:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.159" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I wish I had</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiit, vah! Rogasse vellem,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish I had asked him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime vellem semper tecum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem petisse ab eo quod audio Philippum impetrasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non equidem vellem, quoniam nocitura fuerunt, Pieridum sacris imposuisse manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante equidem summā de re statuisse, Latini, Et vellem, et fuerat melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 303</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.160" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>, the predicate being a <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi> (v. I. B. 9. b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra): <cit><quote lang="la">virum me natam vellem,</quote> <trans><tr>would I had been born a man!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.161" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem, Panaetium nostrum nobiscum haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.162" n="2" level="3"> The subject of the dependent verb in the second person. </sense><sense id="n51298.163" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf.</hi> (the regular construction): <cit><quote lang="la">hodie igitur me videbit, ac vellem tum tu adesses,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish you could be present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem de his etiam oratoribus tibi dicere luberet,</quote> <trans><tr>I wish you would please</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:248" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.164" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. pluperf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I wish you had</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem Idibus Martiis me ad cenam invitasses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem te ad Stoicos inclinavisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem suscepisses juvenem regendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem Bruto studium tuum navare potuisses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.165" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vellem ne veritus esses ne parum libenter legerem tuas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.166" n="d" level="4"> With ellipsis of verb: vera cantas, vana vellem (i. e. cantares). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 4, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.167" n="3" level="3"> With verb in third person. </sense><sense id="n51298.168" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> (the regular construction): <cit><quote lang="la">patrem atque matrem viverent vellem tibi (per ecthesin, v. I. E. b.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem adesset Antonius, modo sine advocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem nobis hoc idem vere dicere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem adesse posset Panaetius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem hoc esset laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:71:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.169" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem aliqui ex vobis robustioribus hunc male dicendi locum suscepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellem dictum esset ab eodem etiam de Dione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem Dareus aliquid ex hac indole hausisset!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 32</bibl></cit> (12), 26.—</sense><sense id="n51298.170" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.171" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I wish he were</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam non abesse ab hujus judicio L. Vulsionem vellem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc mihi ... Vellem, Maeonide, pectus inesse tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:120" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.172" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I wish he had</hi>, <hi rend="ital">had been</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem Menedemum invitatum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas, quas quidem vellem mihi numquam redditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With ellipsis of predicate: illud quoque vellem antea (i. e. factum, or factum esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.173" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl> (v. I. C. 1. a. supra).—</sense><sense id="n51298.174" n="4" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of a neuter pronoun or of a noun: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquando sentiam us nihil nobis nisi, id quod minime vellem, spiritum reliquum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: tris eos libros maxime nunc vellem: apti essent ad id quod cogito, <hi rend="ital">I would like to have</hi> (cf. I. E. 1. a.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 22, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.175" n="5" level="3"> In the other persons of vellem (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n51298.176" n="a" level="4"> Velles. </sense><sense id="n51298.177" n="(a)" level="5"> In optative sentences redundant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 153</bibl> (v. II. A. 1. d.).—</sense><sense id="n51298.178" n="(b)" level="5"> Of an indefinite subject: <cit><quote lang="la">velles eum (Senecam) suo ingenio dixisse, alieno judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 130</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51298.179" n="b" level="4"> Vellet. </sense><sense id="n51298.180" n="(a)" level="5"> In the potential sense of vellem: vellet abesse quidem; <cit><quote lang="la">sed adest. Velletque videre, Non etiam sentire canum fera facta suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 247</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.181" n="(b)" level="5"> Conditionally: <cit><quote lang="la">quis vellet tanti nuntius esse mali (i. e. if in this situation)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.182" n="c" level="4"> Vellent. </sense><sense id="n51298.183" n="(a)" level="5"> In the potential sense of vellem: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellent aethere in alto Nunc of pauperiem et duros perferre labores!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 436</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.184" n="(b)" level="5"> Conditionally: nec superi vellent hoc licuisse sibi, <hi rend="ital">would wish</hi>, i. e. if in this situation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:44:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 44, 8</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n51298.185" n="D" level="2"> Volam and voluero. </sense><sense id="n51298.186" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: respiciendus erit sermo stipulationis, utrumne<cb n="VOLO" />  talis sit: quem voluero, an quem volam. Nam si talis fuerit quem voluero, cum semel elegerit, mutare voluntatem non poterit; <cit><quote lang="la">si vero ... quem volam, donec judicium dictet, mutandi potestatem habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:112" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.187" n="2" level="3"> Volam in principal sentences. </sense><sense id="n51298.188" n="(a)" level="5"> = Engl. future, <hi rend="ital">I shall wish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">et commeminisse hoc ego volam te,</quote> <trans><tr>I shall require you to recollect this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: cum omnia habueris, tunc habere et sapientiam voles? <hi rend="ital">will you also wish to have wisdom when?</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.189" n="(b)" level="5"> Denoting present probability: et scilicet jam me hoc voles patrem exorare, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">you doubtless wish me</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.190" n="3" level="3"> In clauses dependent on predicates implying a future, generally rendered by an English present: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si sors aliter quam voles evenerit?</quote> <trans><tr>otherwise than as you wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum te, si voles, cum patriae quod debes solveris, satis diu vixisse dicito,</quote> <trans><tr>then if you choose</tr>, <tr>if you will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedes cum voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui magis effugies eos qui volent fingere?</quote> <trans><tr>those who are bent upon inventing</tr>, <tr>who will invent</tr>, <tr>falsehoods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod voles gratum esse, rarum effice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 7, 9</bibl>: si di volent, <hi rend="ital">the gods permitting</hi>, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenies, vere si reperire voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 45</bibl>.—So, voluero: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (locum) si qui vitare voluerit, sex milium circuitu in oppidum pervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>who wishes to avoid this spot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.191" n="E" level="2"> Si vis, parenthetically. </sense><sense id="n51298.192" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">If you please</hi> (cf. sis, supra <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">paulum opperirier, Si vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi, si vis, nunc jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic, si vis, de quo disputari velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.193" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">If you wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insist upon it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc quoque jucunditatem, si vis, transfer in animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addam, si vis, animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedam hoc ipsum, si vis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 15, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.194" n="F" level="1"> Quam, with any person of the <hi rend="ital">pres. indic.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">future</hi>, = quamvis, in a concessive sense, virtually, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however much.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.195" n="1" level="3"> 3<hi rend="ital">d pers. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illa, quam velit sit potens, numquam impetravisset (= quamvis sit potens),</quote> <trans><tr>however powerful she may be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Gracchus dixit, sibi in somnis Ti. fratrem visum esse dicere, quam vellet cunctaretur, tamen eodem sibi leto ... esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam volet jocetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.196" n="2" level="3"> 1<hi rend="ital">st pers. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam volumus licet ipsi nos amemus, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.197" n="3" level="3"> 2<hi rend="ital">d pers. plur.</hi>: exspectate facinus quam vultis improbum, vincam tamen, etc., <hi rend="ital">expect a crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however wicked</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ever so wicked</hi>), etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 5, § 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: hac actione quam voletis multi dicent,</quote> <trans><tr>as many as you choose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>, § 102.—</sense><sense id="n51298.198" n="4" level="3"> 3<hi rend="ital">d pers. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam volent illi cedant, tamen a re publicā revocabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam volent in conviviis faceti, dicaces, etc., sint, alia fori vis est, alia triclinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: et ceteri quam volent magnas pecunias capere possint,</quote> <trans><tr>as much money as they choose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:58:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 58, § 142</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.199" n="G" level="1"> Volo = malo, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi>, with a comparative clause (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi in ceteris quoque studiis a multis eligere homines commodissimum quodque, quam sese uni alicui certo vellent addicere, = si se eligere mallent quam se uni addicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malae rei quam nullius duces esse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famaene credi velis quanta urbs a te capta sit, quam posteris quoque eam spectando esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 29, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.200" n="H" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">magis</hi> and <hi rend="ital">maxime.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.201" n="1" level="3"> Magis velle: ut tu illam salvam magis velles quam ego, <hi rend="ital">you wish more than I</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.202" n="2" level="3"> With maxime, <hi rend="ital">to wish above all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more than any thing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">any one else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be most agreeable to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to like best</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi> (among more than two alternatives): <cit><quote lang="la">quia id maxime volo ut illi istoc confugiant,</quote> <trans><tr>wish above all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime vellem, judices, ut P. Sulla, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritate nos capiunt reges, consilio optimates, libertate populi, ut in comparando difficile ad eligendum sit, quid maxime velis,</quote> <trans><tr>which you prefer</tr>, <tr>like best</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>; so, quemadmodum<cb n="VOLO" />  ego maxime vellem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tris eos libros maxime nunc vellem,</quote> <trans><tr>above all others</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia excusanti juveni, alia recipienti futura, ita ut maxime vellet senatus responderi placuit,</quote> <trans><tr>as it was most agreeable to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si di tibi permisissent quo modo maxime velles experiri animum meum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner most convenient to yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n51298.203" n="K" level="1"> In disjunctive co - ordination. </sense><sense id="n51298.204" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">sive ... sive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nunc, sive ego volo, seu nolo, sola me ut vivam facis,</quote> <trans><tr>whether I choose or not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque Campanos sive velint, sive nolint, quieturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.205" n="2" level="3"> Without connectives. </sense><sense id="n51298.206" n="a" level="4"> Vis tu ... vis: <cit><quote lang="la">congredi cum hoste liceat ... vis tu mari, vis terra, vis acie, vis urbibus expugnandis experiri virtutem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.207" n="b" level="4"> Velim nolim. </sense><sense id="n51298.208" n="(a)" level="5"> Interrogatively, = utrum velim nec ne: <cit><quote lang="la">velit nolit scire, difficile est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is difficult to know whether he intends it or not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.209" n="(b)" level="5"> = seu velim seu nolim: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi, velim nolim, sit certa quaedam tuenda sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>whether I will or not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim nolim, in cognomine Scipionum haeream necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors interim adest, cui velis nolis vacandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ita fundatum necesse est, velit nolit, sequatur hilaritas continua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velint nolint, respondendum est ... beate vivere bonum non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 117, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterea futuri principes, velint nolint, sciant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit><mood>Part.</mood> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlens</orth>, entis. </sense><sense id="n51298.210" n="A" level="2"> As a <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> proper, retaining the meaning and construction of velle, with the force of a relative or adverbial clause. </sense><sense id="n51298.211" n="1" level="3"> Agreeing with some member of the sentence (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): neque illum ... multa volentem Dicere praeterea vidit (= qui multa voluit dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 501</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 790</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me vis ulla volentem Avertet (i. e. si adhaerere foederi volo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 203</bibl></cit>: decemviri, minuere volentes hujuscemodi violentiam ... putaverunt, etc., <hi rend="ital">intending</hi> (<hi rend="ital">who intended</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to diminish such a violence</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo, experiri etiamtunc volens, an ullae sibi reliquae vires adessent ... rescindere quercum conatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio quosdam testatores, efficere volentes ne servi sui umquam ad libertatem venirent, etc., hactenus scribere solitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:61" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te volentem ad prohibendum venire, deterruerit aliquis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:1:section=10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 24, 1, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.212" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne cujus militis scripti nomen nisi ipso volente deleretur,</quote> <trans><tr>except with his consent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Teum ex medio cursu classem repente avertit, aut volentibus iis usurus commeatu parato hostibus, aut ipsos pro hostibus habiturus,</quote> <trans><tr>with their consent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponuntque ferocia Poeni Corda, volente deo,</quote> <trans><tr>since the god willed it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 303</bibl></cit>: Thrasippo supplicium a se voluntariā morte exigere volente, <hi rend="ital">while he was about to inflict punishment on himself</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl>, ext. 2: scire volentibus immortalibus dis an Romana virtus imperium orbis mereretur, <hi rend="ital">it being the will of the gods to know</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl> (1, 7, 3): qui sciente aut volente eo ad quem res pertinet, possessionem nanciscitur, <hi rend="ital">with the knowledge and consent of the person who</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.213" n="B" level="2"> As <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, and hence, <hi rend="ital">favorably disposed</hi> (opp. invitus). </sense><sense id="n51298.214" n="1" level="3"> Attributively. </sense><sense id="n51298.215" n="a" level="4"> In the phrase cum dis volentibus, lit. <hi rend="ital">with the willing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favoring gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with the will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">favor of the gods</hi>: dono ducite doque volentibu' cum magnis dis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 208 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sequere hac, mea gnata, me cum dis volentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dis volentibus quodque bene eveniat mando tibi Mani uti illaec suovetaurilia, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl></cit> (142).— And without <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute ac dis volentibus magni estis et opulenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.216" n="b" level="4"> Volenti animo. </sense><sense id="n51298.217" n="(a)" level="5"> = cupide, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae plebes litteris quae de Metello ac Mario missae erant, volenti animo de ambobus acceperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51298.218" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">On purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio hanc omnes animisque volentibus urbem Adferimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 216</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.219" n="2" level="3"> Predicatively. </sense><sense id="n51298.220" n="a" level="4"> Agreeing with the <hi rend="ital">subject-nom.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subject - acc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51298.221" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <pb n="2011" /> <cb n="VOLO" /> <hi rend="ital">gladly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(hi) divini generis appellentur ... vobisque jure et lege volentes pareant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas victi ab hostibus poenas metuerant, eas ipsi volentes pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia volentes in amicitiam non veniebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si volentes ac non coacti mansissent in amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocunque loco seu volens seu invitus constitisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque se numquam volentem parte quā posset rerum consilio gerendarum cessurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virtus), quidquid evenerit, feret, non patiens tantum, sed etiam volens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est referre gratiam quod volens acceperis nolenti reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:40:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 4, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volens vos Turnus adoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 677</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 457</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 146</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 833: date vina volentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 275</bibl></cit>: ipsa autem macie tenuant armenta volentes (<hi rend="ital">on purpose</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 129</bibl>.—And referring to subjects denoting things: quos rami fructus, quos ipsa volentia rura Sponte tulere suā, carpsit (<hi rend="ital">spontaneously and willingly</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 500</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.222" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Favorably;</hi> with propitius, <hi rend="ital">favorably and kindly</hi>, referring to the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">precantes Jovem ut volens propitius praebeat sacra arma pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precantibus ut volens propitiaque urbem Romanam iniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā arce (Victoriam) sacratam, volentem propitiamque, firmam ac stabilem fore populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 3</bibl>; 24, 38, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2489 sq.</bibl>—Parodied by Plautus: <cit><quote lang="la">agite, bibite, festivae fores! fite mihi volentes propitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia diis propitiis volentibusque ea faciemus,</quote> <trans><tr>with the favor and help of the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si (Jovem) invocem ut dexter ac volens assit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. 5.—</sense><sense id="n51298.223" n="b" level="4"> Agreeing with other terms of the sentence (rare): volenti consuli causa in Pamphyliam devertendi oblata est, <hi rend="ital">a welcome cause was offered to the consul</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nobis volentibus facile continget,</quote> <trans><tr>if we wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is Ariobarzanem volentibus Armeniis praefecit,</quote> <trans><tr>to their satisfaction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemis ... hominem, Urse, tuum, cui dulce volenti servitium ... erat,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom his servitude was sweet</tr>, <tr>since he liked it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me mea virtus, etc., fatis egere volentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ille volentem castigabat erum,</quote> <trans><tr>administered kindly received rebukes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.224" n="c" level="4"> In the phrase aliquid mihi volenti est or putatur, etc., <hi rend="ital">something is welcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable to me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleases me</hi> (= volens habeo or accipio aliquid; cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(umi=n tau=ta boulome/nois e)sti/n</foreign>, and, mihi aliquid cupienti est; v. cupio; <cit><quote lang="la">rare but class.): uti militibus exaequatus cum imperatore labos volentibus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>that the equalization of labor was acceptable to the soldier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia neque plebei militia volenti putabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 3</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">grande periculum maritumis civitatibus esse, et quibusdam volentibus novas res fore,</quote> <trans><tr>that to some a change of the government would be welcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus bellum volentibus erat, probare exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subject - inf.</hi>: ceterisque remanere et in verba Vespasiani adigi volentibus fuit, <hi rend="ital">to the rest it was acceptable to remain</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 43</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-inf.</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">si volentibus vobis erit, in medium profero quae ... legisse memini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si volentibus vobis erit, diem fabulis et epulis exigamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n51298.225" n="3" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n51298.226" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = is qui vult, in the different meanings, and often with the construction of the verb. </sense><sense id="n51298.227" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who wishes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cis Hiberum castra Romana esse, arcem tutam perfugiumque novas volentibus res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere se volentibus vacuas aures accommodavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus libertate si volentibus luxu perire non licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discere meliora volentibus promptum est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it depends on our own will to learn better things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sum in hoc sollicitus, dum res ipsa volentibus discere appareat,</quote> <trans><tr>to the students</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori volentibus vis adhibita vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.228" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who intends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris ignorantia non prodest acquirere volentibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the acquisition of property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis volentem incipere uti frui prohibuit,</quote> <trans><tr>one who is about to enter upon a usufruct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:3:section=14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 16, 3, § 14</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VOLO" /> —</sense><sense id="n51298.229" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who is willing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non refert quid sit quod datur, nisi a volente volenti datur,</quote> <trans><tr>unless it is both willingly given and received</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:18:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducunt volentem fata, nolentem trahunt,</quote> <trans><tr>those willing to follow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 107, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51298.230" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">One who consents</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutiusque rati volentibus quam coactis imperitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to rule men with their consent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe rempublicam si a volentibus nequeat ab invitis jus expetituram,</quote> <trans><tr>peaceably if they could</tr>, <tr>forcibly if they must</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aliam rem pro aliā volenti solverit,</quote> <trans><tr>if one pays with the consent of the receiver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla injuria est quae in volentem fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 10, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">One who does a thing voluntarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam etiam a volentibus acceperant,</quote> <trans><tr>the contributions of money were voluntary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:62:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce, puer, stimulis ... (solis equi) Sponte sua properant. Labor est inhibere volentis (i. e. properare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Volens = bene volens: munificus nemo habebatur nisi pariter volens, <hi rend="ital">unless he was just as kindly disposed</hi>, sc. <hi rend="ital">as he was liberal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 6</bibl>.—Often referring to a previously mentioned noun: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cape consiliis socium et conjunge volentem,</quote> <trans><tr>and unite with him</tr>, <tr>since he wishes it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 712</bibl></cit>; so may be taken <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 128</bibl> (v. <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n51298.231" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> (volentia) rare, always with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">things pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius multis suspitionibus volentia plebi facturus habebatur,</quote> <trans><tr>that he would do what pleased the common people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 31</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque talia plebi volentia fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 36</bibl></cit> Draeg. ad loc. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">iique Muciano volentia rescripsere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51299" type="main" key="vo^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n51299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. gen. plur.</hi> volantūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1083</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. val-, to turn one's self, etc.; cf.: vŏlucer, vēlox, and vol- in velivolus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51299.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ex alto ... laeva volavit avis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 95 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipitres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1010</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altam supra volat ardea nubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volat ille per aëra magnum Remigio alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae venere volantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl> (3, 28), 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:251" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 251</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volasse eum (Antonium), non iter fecisse diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine pennis volare haud facile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51299.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlantes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the birds</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1083</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 728</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51299.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to move swiftly like one flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i sane ... vola curriculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per summa levis volat aequora curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios volat ecce per hostes Vectus equo spumante Saces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (Argo) volat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 971</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae Capuam ad Pompeium volare dicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volat aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1141" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et semel emissum volat irrevocabile verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 71</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ast Erebi virgo ditem volat aethere Memphim Praecipere et Phariā venientem pellere terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:407" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51300" type="main" key="vo^lo3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a volunteer</hi>, first applied to the slaves who, after the battle at Cannæ, were enrolled upon their own expressed desire to serve (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">volones dicti sunt milites, qui post Cannensem cladem usque ad octo milia, cum essent servi, voluntarie se ad militiam obtulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. p. 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volones, quia sponte hoc voluerunt, appellati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus miles tironi, liber voloni sese exaequari sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
